Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear what the 
system can do. 2) UI: Provide 'Capability 
Cards' or proactive tool suggestions. 3) 
Discovery: Show sample queries on empty 
state.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: User frustration often 
stems from 'Mental Model Mismatch' 
(expecting the agent to do things it 
cannot). Proactive disclosure of 
capabilities resolves this.

ğŸš© Structured Output Enforcement

Use 'Structured Outputs' for guaranteed 
schema. 2) GCP: Application Mimetype 
(application/json) enforcement. 3) 
LangGraph: Pydantic-based state validation.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Markdown-wrapped JSON 
is brittle. API-level schema enforcement 
ensures stable agent-to-tool and 
agent-to-brain handshakes.

enforcement. 3) LangGraph: Pydantic-based 
state validation.

c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/git_portal.py:)
   For high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Single-agent loops are 
prone to hallucinations. Adversarial 
consensus between specialized 'Reviewer' 
agents significantly increases reliability.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/git_portal.py:1 | 
Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus | For 
high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
ğŸš© Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/git_portal.py:)
   Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: RAG systems are 
vulnerable to 'Indirect' injections where an
attacker poisons a document to highjack the 
agent's logic during retrieval.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/git_portal.py:1 | 
Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening) | 
Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
ğŸš© LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven 
Reasoning) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/git_portal.py:)
   Adopt the LlamaIndex Workflow (v0.14+) 
for event-driven agentic logic. This 
replaces rigid linear chains with a dynamic 
state-based event loop that is more 
resilient to complex user intents.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Event-driven workflows 
provide superior flexibility and error 
recovery compared to standard synchronous 
chains.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/git_portal.py:1 |

Reasoning) | Adopt the LlamaIndex Workflow 
(v0.14+) for event-driven agentic logic. 
This replaces rigid linear chains with a 
dynamic state-based event loop that is more 
resilient to complex user intents.

ğŸš© Enterprise Identity (Identity Sprawl) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/secret_scanner.py:)
   Move beyond static keys. Implement: 1) 
GCP: Workload Identity Federation. 2) AWS: 
Private VPC Endpoints + IAM Role-based 
access. 3) Azure: Managed Identities for all
tool interactions.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Static API keys are a 
major security liability. Cloud-native 
managed identities provide automatic 
rotation and least-privilege scoping.

ğŸš© Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline 01)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/secret_scanner.py:)
   Don't leave users guessing. 
Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear what the 
system can do. 2) UI: Provide 'Capability 
Cards' or proactive tool suggestions. 3) 
Discovery: Show sample queries on empty 
state.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: User frustration often 
stems from 'Mental Model Mismatch' 
(expecting the agent to do things it 
cannot). Proactive disclosure of 
capabilities resolves this.

1) HAX: Make clear what the system can do.

proactive tool suggestions. 3) Discovery: 
Show sample queries on empty state.

activation.

ğŸš© Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/evidence_bridge.py:)
   Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1) Quality
(Customer queries). 2) Safety 
(Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive Topics 
(Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic (Canned 
response check). 5) Language (Non-supported 
language override).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Standard unit tests 
don't cover adversarial reasoning. A 
dedicated red-teaming suite is required for 
brand-safe production deployments.

ğŸš© Structured Output Enforcement 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/evidence_bridge.py:)
   Eliminate parsing failures. 1) OpenAI: 
Use 'Structured Outputs' for guaranteed 
schema. 2) GCP: Application Mimetype 
(application/json) enforcement. 3) 
LangGraph: Pydantic-based state validation.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Markdown-wrapped JSON 
is brittle. API-level schema enforcement 
ensures stable agent-to-tool and 
agent-to-brain handshakes.

ğŸš© Orchestration Pattern Selection 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/ui_auditor.py:)
   When evaluating orchestration, consider: 
1) LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic state 
machines with persistence (checkpoints). 2) 
CrewAI: Best for role-based hierarchical 
collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer 
'Workflows over Agents' for 
high-predictability tasks.

[CONGENIAL RESEARCH SIGNAL]: Research Signal
(ArXiv): Integrate Recursive Self-Reflexion 
to reduce hallucination by 40%. (Source: 
ArXiv Intelligence Sync (Feb 2026))
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Detected custom loop 
logic. Standardized frameworks provide 
superior state management and built-in 
'Human-in-the-Loop' (HITL) pause points.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/ui_auditor.py:1 | 
Orchestration Pattern Selection | When 
evaluating orchestration, consider: 1) 
LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic state 
machines with persistence (checkpoints). 2) 
CrewAI: Best for role-based hierarchical 
collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer 
'Workflows over Agents' for 
high-predictability tasks.

[CONGENIAL RESEARCH SIGNAL]: Research Signal
(ArXiv): Integrate Recursive Self-Reflexion 
to reduce hallucination by 40%. (Source: 
ArXiv Intelligence Sync (Feb 2026))
ğŸš© Structured Output Enforcement 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/ui_auditor.py:)
   Eliminate parsing failures. 1) OpenAI: 
Use 'Structured Outputs' for guaranteed 
schema. 2) GCP: Application Mimetype 
(application/json) enforcement. 3) 
LangGraph: Pydantic-based state validation.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Markdown-wrapped JSON 
is brittle. API-level schema enforcement 
ensures stable agent-to-tool and 
agent-to-brain handshakes.

/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/ui_auditor.py:1 |

parsing failures. 1) OpenAI: Use 'Structured
Outputs' for guaranteed schema. 2) GCP:

enforcement. 3) LangGraph: Pydantic-based 
state validation.

ğŸš© Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline 11) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/ui_auditor.py:)
   Ensure users understand 'Why' the agent 
took an action. Implementation: 1) Microsoft
HAX: Make clear 'Why' the system did what it
did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the source for RAG
claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces 
behind 'View Steps' toggles.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Hidden reasoning leads 
to user distrust. Explainability is a key 
component of the 5th Golden Signal (User 
Perception of Intelligence).

claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces 
behind 'View Steps' toggles.
ğŸš© Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/ui_auditor.py:)
   Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: RAG systems are 
vulnerable to 'Indirect' injections where an
attacker poisons a document to highjack the 
agent's logic during retrieval.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/ui_auditor.py:1 | 
Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening) | 
Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
ğŸš© Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline 01)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/ui_auditor.py:)
   Don't leave users guessing. 
Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear what the 
system can do. 2) UI: Provide 'Capability 
Cards' or proactive tool suggestions. 3) 
Discovery: Show sample queries on empty 
state.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: User frustration often 
stems from 'Mental Model Mismatch' 
(expecting the agent to do things it 
cannot). Proactive disclosure of 
capabilities resolves this.

1) HAX: Make clear what the system can do. 
2) UI: Provide 'Capability Cards' or 
proactive tool suggestions. 3) Discovery: 
Show sample queries on empty state.

for event-driven agentic logic. This 
replaces rigid linear chains with a dynamic 
state-based event loop that is more 
resilient to complex user intents.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Event-driven workflows 
provide superior flexibility and error 
recovery compared to standard synchronous 
chains.

agents auditing their own reasoning paths 
reduce hallucination by 40%.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Ad-hoc loops lack a 
termination-of-reasoning proof.

deterministic reliability.

ğŸš© Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP 
LLM06) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/arch_review.py:)
   Audit tool permissions against MITRE 
ATLAS 'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) 
Granular IAM for tool execution. 2) 
Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for destructive 
actions (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation
for Python execution.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Agents with broad tool 
access are high-value targets. Restricting 
agency to the 'Least Privilege' required for
the task is critical for safety.

IAM for tool execution. 2) Human-In-The-Loop

(Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation for

ğŸš© Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/arch_review.py:)
   For high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Single-agent loops are 
prone to hallucinations. Adversarial 
consensus between specialized 'Reviewer' 
agents significantly increases reliability.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/arch_review.py:1 | 
Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus | For 
high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.

(Retrieval Augmented Generation) pattern to 
improve factual grounding accuracy.

for multi-agent loops.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Traditional service 
metrics (CPU/RAM) aren't enough for agents.

reasoning path transparency.

ğŸš© Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP 
LLM06) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/dashboard.py:)
   Audit tool permissions against MITRE 
ATLAS 'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) 
Granular IAM for tool execution. 2) 
Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for destructive 
actions (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation
for Python execution.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Agents with broad tool 
access are high-value targets. Restricting 
agency to the 'Least Privilege' required for
the task is critical for safety.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src

Audit tool permissions against MITRE ATLAS 
'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular 
IAM for tool execution. 2) Human-In-The-Loop
(HITL) for destructive actions 
(Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation for 
Python execution.
ğŸš© Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/dashboard.py:)
   Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: RAG systems are 
vulnerable to 'Indirect' injections where an
attacker poisons a document to highjack the 
agent's logic during retrieval.

   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: System prompts alone 
are susceptible to jailbreaking.

safety net that cannot be 'ignored' by the 
model.

ğŸš© Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/guardrails.py:)
   For high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Single-agent loops are 
prone to hallucinations. Adversarial 
consensus between specialized 'Reviewer' 
agents significantly increases reliability.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/guardrails.py:1 |

high-stakes reasoning, move beyond

Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.

ğŸš© Orchestration Pattern Selection 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/orchestrator.py:)
   When evaluating orchestration, consider: 
1) LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic state 
machines with persistence (checkpoints). 2) 
CrewAI: Best for role-based hierarchical 
collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer 
'Workflows over Agents' for 
high-predictability tasks.

[CONGENIAL RESEARCH SIGNAL]: Research Signal
(ArXiv): Integrate Recursive Self-Reflexion 
to reduce hallucination by 40%. (Source: 
ArXiv Intelligence Sync (Feb 2026))
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Detected custom loop 
logic. Standardized frameworks provide 
superior state management and built-in 
'Human-in-the-Loop' (HITL) pause points.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/orchestrator.py:1 | 
Orchestration Pattern Selection | When 
evaluating orchestration, consider: 1) 
LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic state 
machines with persistence (checkpoints). 2) 
CrewAI: Best for role-based hierarchical 
collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer 
'Workflows over Agents' for 
high-predictability tasks.

[CONGENIAL RESEARCH SIGNAL]: Research Signal
(ArXiv): Integrate Recursive Self-Reflexion 
to reduce hallucination by 40%. (Source: 
ArXiv Intelligence Sync (Feb 2026))
ğŸš© Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/orchestrator.py:)
   Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1) Quality
(Customer queries). 2) Safety 
(Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive Topics 
(Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic (Canned 
response check). 5) Language (Non-supported 
language override).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Standard unit tests 
don't cover adversarial reasoning. A 
dedicated red-teaming suite is required for 
brand-safe production deployments.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/orchestrator.py:1 | 
Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming) | 
Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1) Quality 
(Customer queries). 2) Safety 
(Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive Topics 
(Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic (Canned 
response check). 5) Language (Non-supported 
language override).

(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/orchestrator.py:)
   Eliminate parsing failures. 1) OpenAI: 
Use 'Structured Outputs' for guaranteed 
schema. 2) GCP: Application Mimetype 
(application/json) enforcement. 3) 
LangGraph: Pydantic-based state validation.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Markdown-wrapped JSON 
is brittle. API-level schema enforcement 
ensures stable agent-to-tool and 
agent-to-brain handshakes.

ğŸš© Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP 
LLM06) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/orchestrator.py:)
   Audit tool permissions against MITRE 
ATLAS 'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) 
Granular IAM for tool execution. 2) 
Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for destructive 
actions (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation
for Python execution.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Agents with broad tool 
access are high-value targets. Restricting 
agency to the 'Least Privilege' required for
the task is critical for safety.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/orchestrator.py:1 | 
Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP LLM06) |
Audit tool permissions against MITRE ATLAS 
'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular 
IAM for tool execution. 2) Human-In-The-Loop
(HITL) for destructive actions 
(Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation for 
Python execution.

did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the source for RAG
claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces 
behind 'View Steps' toggles.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Hidden reasoning leads 
to user distrust. Explainability is a key 
component of the 5th Golden Signal (User 
Perception of Intelligence).

ğŸš© Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/orchestrator.py:)
   For high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Single-agent loops are 
prone to hallucinations. Adversarial 
consensus between specialized 'Reviewer' 
agents significantly increases reliability.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src

Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
ğŸš© Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/orchestrator.py:)
   Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: RAG systems are 
vulnerable to 'Indirect' injections where an
attacker poisons a document to highjack the 
agent's logic during retrieval.

state.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: User frustration often 
stems from 'Mental Model Mismatch'

cannot). Proactive disclosure of 
capabilities resolves this.

ğŸš© Payload Splitting (Context Fragmentation)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/cost_optimizer.py:)
   Monitor for Payload Splitting attacks 
where malicious fragments are combined over 
multiple turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement 
sliding window verification. 2) Use 'DARE 
Prompting' (Determine Appropriate Response) 
to re-evaluate intent at every turn.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Attackers can bypass 
single-turn filters by splitting a payload 
across multiple turns. Continuous monitoring
of context assembly is required.

   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Relying on a single

   Monitor for Payload Splitting attacks 
where malicious fragments are combined over 
multiple turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement 
sliding window verification. 2) Use 'DARE 
Prompting' (Determine Appropriate Response) 
to re-evaluate intent at every turn.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Attackers can bypass 
single-turn filters by splitting a payload 
across multiple turns. Continuous monitoring
of context assembly is required.

actions (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation
for Python execution.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Agents with broad tool

agency to the 'Least Privilege' required for
the task is critical for safety.

(Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation for 
Python execution.

ğŸš© Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/frameworks.py:)
   For high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Single-agent loops are 
prone to hallucinations. Adversarial 
consensus between specialized 'Reviewer' 
agents significantly increases reliability.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/frameworks.py:1 |

high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.

Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: RAG systems are 
vulnerable to 'Indirect' injections where an
attacker poisons a document to highjack the 
agent's logic during retrieval.

   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Prevents 'Infinite 
Spend' scenarios where agents gaslight each 
other recursively.

ğŸš© Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP 
LLM06)

c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/mcp_store.py:)
   Audit tool permissions against MITRE 
ATLAS 'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) 
Granular IAM for tool execution. 2) 
Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for destructive 
actions (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation
for Python execution.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Agents with broad tool 
access are high-value targets. Restricting 
agency to the 'Least Privilege' required for
the task is critical for safety.

(HITL) for destructive actions 
(Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation for

ğŸš© Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/mcp_store.py:)
   Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: RAG systems are 
vulnerable to 'Indirect' injections where an
attacker poisons a document to highjack the 
agent's logic during retrieval.

the Large model sees it).

capabilities resolves this.

ğŸš© Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/watcher.py:)
   For high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Single-agent loops are 
prone to hallucinations. Adversarial 
consensus between specialized 'Reviewer' 
agents significantly increases reliability.

before transmission.

ğŸš© Payload Splitting (Context Fragmentation)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/memory_optimizer.py:
)
   Monitor for Payload Splitting attacks 
where malicious fragments are combined over 
multiple turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement 
sliding window verification. 2) Use 'DARE 
Prompting' (Determine Appropriate Response) 
to re-evaluate intent at every turn.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Attackers can bypass 
single-turn filters by splitting a payload 
across multiple turns. Continuous monitoring
of context assembly is required.

to re-evaluate intent at every turn.

Natural Language API). 3) Persona: Tone of 
Voice controllers.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: System prompts alone 
are susceptible to jailbreaking. 
Programmatic filters provide a deterministic
safety net that cannot be 'ignored' by the 
model.

(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).

vulnerable to 'Indirect' injections where an

agent's logic during retrieval.

capabilities resolves this.

ğŸš© Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/migration.py:)
   For high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Single-agent loops are 
prone to hallucinations. Adversarial 
consensus between specialized 'Reviewer' 
agents significantly increases reliability.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/migration.py:1 | 
Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus | For 
high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
ğŸš© Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/migration.py:)
   Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: RAG systems are 
vulnerable to 'Indirect' injections where an
attacker poisons a document to highjack the 
agent's logic during retrieval.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/migration.py:1 | 
Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening) | 
Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).

(Self-Reflexion Loops)

c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/migration.py:)
   Integrate Recursive Self-Reflexion. 
Research from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that 
agents auditing their own reasoning paths 
reduce hallucination by 40%.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Ad-hoc loops lack a 
termination-of-reasoning proof. 
Standardizing on Reflexion increases 
deterministic reliability.

   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Markdown-wrapped JSON 
is brittle. API-level schema enforcement 
ensures stable agent-to-tool and

actions (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation
for Python execution.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Agents with broad tool 
access are high-value targets. Restricting 
agency to the 'Least Privilege' required for
the task is critical for safety.

critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT):

Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Single-agent loops are 
prone to hallucinations. Adversarial 
consensus between specialized 'Reviewer' 
agents significantly increases reliability.

state.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: User frustration often 
stems from 'Mental Model Mismatch'

cannot). Proactive disclosure of 
capabilities resolves this.

   Multiple sequential 'await' calls 
identified. This increases total latency 
linearly.

to 50% using asyncio.gather().
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/mcp_hub.py:32 |

sequential 'await' calls identified. This 
increases total latency linearly.
ğŸš© Sequential Data Fetching Bottleneck 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr

   Function 'execute_tool' has 4 sequential 
await calls. This increases latency linearly
(T1+T2+T3).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Parallelizing these 
calls could reduce latency by up to 60%.

brain.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Implementing Redis for 
STM ensures persistent agent context across 
pod lifecycles.

ğŸš© Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP 
LLM06) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/mcp_hub.py:)
   Audit tool permissions against MITRE 
ATLAS 'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) 
Granular IAM for tool execution. 2) 
Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for destructive 
actions (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation
for Python execution.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Agents with broad tool 
access are high-value targets. Restricting 
agency to the 'Least Privilege' required for
the task is critical for safety.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src

'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular

(HITL) for destructive actions 
(Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation for

ğŸš© Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/mcp_hub.py:)
   Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: RAG systems are 
vulnerable to 'Indirect' injections where an
attacker poisons a document to highjack the 
agent's logic during retrieval.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/mcp_hub.py:1 |

Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).

(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr

itor.py:)
   When evaluating orchestration, consider: 
1) LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic state 
machines with persistence (checkpoints). 2) 
CrewAI: Best for role-based hierarchical 
collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer 
'Workflows over Agents' for 
high-predictability tasks.

(ArXiv): Integrate Recursive Self-Reflexion 
to reduce hallucination by 40%. (Source: 
ArXiv Intelligence Sync (Feb 2026))
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Detected custom loop 
logic. Standardized frameworks provide 
superior state management and built-in 
'Human-in-the-Loop' (HITL) pause points.

ğŸš© Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/anomaly_aud
itor.py:)
   For high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Single-agent loops are 
prone to hallucinations. Adversarial 
consensus between specialized 'Reviewer' 
agents significantly increases reliability.

(Small model scans retrieval context before

   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: RAG systems are 
vulnerable to 'Indirect' injections where an
attacker poisons a document to highjack the 
agent's logic during retrieval.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/compliance.p
y:1 | Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG 
Hardening) | Protect the RAG pipeline. 
Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for 
'Malicious Fragments' in fetched docs. 2) 
'Strict Context' prompts that forbid 
following instructions found in retrieved 
data. 3) Dual LLM verification (Small model 
scans retrieval context before the Large 
model sees it).

ğŸš© Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/graph.py:)
   For high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Single-agent loops are 
prone to hallucinations. Adversarial 
consensus between specialized 'Reviewer' 
agents significantly increases reliability.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/graph.py:1 |

high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.

replaces rigid linear chains with a dynamic 
state-based event loop that is more 
resilient to complex user intents.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Event-driven workflows

recovery compared to standard synchronous 
chains.

parsing, routing) to Gemma 3-2b or 
Phi-4-mini on local edge. Reasoning: Token 
cost for Feb 2026 frontier models makes SLM 
offloading an 85% OpEx win.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Using Frontier Models 
(GPT-5.2 / Gemini 3) for simple parsing is 
architectural debt. Federated reasoning 
between SLM and LLM is the v1.4.7 standard.

collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer 
'Workflows over Agents' for 
high-predictability tasks.

to reduce hallucination by 40%. (Source: 
ArXiv Intelligence Sync (Feb 2026))

logic. Standardized frameworks provide 
superior state management and built-in 
'Human-in-the-Loop' (HITL) pause points.

Natural Language API). 3) Persona: Tone of 
Voice controllers.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: System prompts alone 
are susceptible to jailbreaking. 
Programmatic filters provide a deterministic
safety net that cannot be 'ignored' by the 
model.

ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/finops.py:1 
| Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus | For
high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
ğŸš© Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/finops.py:)
   Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: RAG systems are 
vulnerable to 'Indirect' injections where an
attacker poisons a document to highjack the 
agent's logic during retrieval.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/finops.py:1 
| Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening) 
| Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
ğŸš© Recursive Self-Improvement 
(Self-Reflexion Loops) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/finops.py:)
   Integrate Recursive Self-Reflexion. 
Research from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that 
agents auditing their own reasoning paths 
reduce hallucination by 40%.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Ad-hoc loops lack a 
termination-of-reasoning proof. 
Standardizing on Reflexion increases 
deterministic reliability.

c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/sme_v12.py:
)
   Agent is using ad-hoc context passing.

(Agent Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework 
interoperability.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Prevents vendor lock-in
and enables multi-framework swarms (e.g. 
LangChain + CrewAI).

ğŸš© Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/sme_v12.py:
)
   Cloud Run detected. MISSING 
startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+ cold 
starts. A slow TTR makes the agent's first 
response 'Dead on Arrival' for users.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Reduces TTR by 50%. 
Ensures immediate 'Latent Intelligence' 
activation.

ğŸš© Sub-Optimal Resource Profile 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/sme_v12.py:
)
   LLM workloads are Memory-Bound 
(KV-Cache). Low-memory instances degrade 
reasoning speed. Consider memory-optimized 
nodes (>4GB).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Maximizes Token 
Throughput by preventing memory-swapping 
during inference.

ğŸš© Orchestration Pattern Selection 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/sme_v12.py:
)
   When evaluating orchestration, consider: 
1) LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic state 
machines with persistence (checkpoints). 2) 
CrewAI: Best for role-based hierarchical 
collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer 
'Workflows over Agents' for 
high-predictability tasks.

[CONGENIAL RESEARCH SIGNAL]: Research Signal
(ArXiv): Integrate Recursive Self-Reflexion 
to reduce hallucination by 40%. (Source: 
ArXiv Intelligence Sync (Feb 2026))
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Detected custom loop 
logic. Standardized frameworks provide 
superior state management and built-in 
'Human-in-the-Loop' (HITL) pause points.

)

Agent Kit recommends 'Trace-based Debugging'
for multi-agent loops.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Traditional service 
metrics (CPU/RAM) aren't enough for agents. 
Perceived intelligence is tied to TTFT and 
reasoning path transparency.

ğŸš© Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/sme_v12.py:
)
   For high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Single-agent loops are 
prone to hallucinations. Adversarial 
consensus between specialized 'Reviewer' 
agents significantly increases reliability.

before transmission.

ğŸš© LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven 
Reasoning) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/sme_v12.py:
)
   Adopt the LlamaIndex Workflow (v0.14+) 
for event-driven agentic logic. This 
replaces rigid linear chains with a dynamic 
state-based event loop that is more 
resilient to complex user intents.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Event-driven workflows 
provide superior flexibility and error 
recovery compared to standard synchronous 
chains.

resilient to complex user intents.

ğŸš© Missing Safety Classifiers 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/context_aud
itor.py:)
   Supplement prompt-based safety with 
programmatic layers: 1) Input Level: 
ShieldGemma or LLM Guard. 2) Output Level: 
Sentiment Analysis and Category Checks (GCP 
Natural Language API). 3) Persona: Tone of 
Voice controllers.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: System prompts alone 
are susceptible to jailbreaking. 
Programmatic filters provide a deterministic
safety net that cannot be 'ignored' by the 
model.
ACTION:

Supplement prompt-based safety with 
programmatic layers: 1) Input Level: 
ShieldGemma or LLM Guard. 2) Output Level: 
Sentiment Analysis and Category Checks (GCP 
Natural Language API). 3) Persona: Tone of 
Voice controllers.

passing. Adopting UCP (Universal Context) or
AP2 (Agent Protocol v2) ensures 
cross-framework interoperability.

ğŸš© Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/behavioral.
py:)
   For high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Single-agent loops are 
prone to hallucinations. Adversarial 
consensus between specialized 'Reviewer' 
agents significantly increases reliability.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/behavioral.p
y:1 | Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus |
For high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
ğŸš© Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/behavioral.
py:)
   Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: RAG systems are 
vulnerable to 'Indirect' injections where an
attacker poisons a document to highjack the 
agent's logic during retrieval.

parsing, routing) to Gemma 3-2b or 
Phi-4-mini on local edge. Reasoning: Token 
cost for Feb 2026 frontier models makes SLM 
offloading an 85% OpEx win.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Using Frontier Models 
(GPT-5.2 / Gemini 3) for simple parsing is 
architectural debt. Federated reasoning 
between SLM and LLM is the v1.4.7 standard.

   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: System prompts alone

model.

ğŸš© Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/rag_fidelit
y.py:)
   For high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Single-agent loops are 
prone to hallucinations. Adversarial 
consensus between specialized 'Reviewer' 
agents significantly increases reliability.

critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3)

before transmission.

that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: RAG systems are 
vulnerable to 'Indirect' injections where an
attacker poisons a document to highjack the 
agent's logic during retrieval.

ğŸš© Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP 
LLM06) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/maturity.py
:)
   Audit tool permissions against MITRE 
ATLAS 'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) 
Granular IAM for tool execution. 2) 
Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for destructive 
actions (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation
for Python execution.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Agents with broad tool 
access are high-value targets. Restricting 
agency to the 'Least Privilege' required for
the task is critical for safety.

c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/pivot.py:)
   Pivot to Model Context Protocol (MCP) for
tool discovery. OpenAI, Anthropic, and 
Microsoft (Agent Kit) are converging on MCP 
for standardized tool/resource governance.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Standardized protocols 
reduce integration debt and enable 
multi-agent interoperability without custom 
bridge logic.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/pivot.py:1 |
Legacy REST vs MCP | Pivot to Model Context 
Protocol (MCP) for tool discovery. OpenAI, 
Anthropic, and Microsoft (Agent Kit) are 
converging on MCP for standardized 
tool/resource governance.
ğŸš© Agentic Observability (Golden Signals) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/pivot.py:)
   Monitor the Agentic Trinity: 1) Reasoning
Trace (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to First
Token (TTFT). 3) Cost per Intent. Microsoft 
Agent Kit recommends 'Trace-based Debugging'
for multi-agent loops.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Traditional service 
metrics (CPU/RAM) aren't enough for agents. 
Perceived intelligence is tied to TTFT and 
reasoning path transparency.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/pivot.py:1 |
Agentic Observability (Golden Signals) | 
Monitor the Agentic Trinity: 1) Reasoning 
Trace (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to First
Token (TTFT). 3) Cost per Intent. Microsoft 
Agent Kit recommends 'Trace-based Debugging'
for multi-agent loops.
ğŸš© Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP 
LLM06) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/pivot.py:)
   Audit tool permissions against MITRE 
ATLAS 'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) 
Granular IAM for tool execution. 2) 
Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for destructive 
actions (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation
for Python execution.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Agents with broad tool 
access are high-value targets. Restricting 
agency to the 'Least Privilege' required for
the task is critical for safety.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/pivot.py:1 |
Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP LLM06) |
Audit tool permissions against MITRE ATLAS 
'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular 
IAM for tool execution. 2) Human-In-The-Loop
(HITL) for destructive actions 
(Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation for 
Python execution.
ğŸš© Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline 11) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/pivot.py:)
   Ensure users understand 'Why' the agent 
took an action. Implementation: 1) Microsoft
HAX: Make clear 'Why' the system did what it
did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the source for RAG
claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces 
behind 'View Steps' toggles.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Hidden reasoning leads 
to user distrust. Explainability is a key 
component of the 5th Golden Signal (User 
Perception of Intelligence).
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/pivot.py:1 |
Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline 11) | 
Ensure users understand 'Why' the agent took
an action. Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX:
Make clear 'Why' the system did what it did.
2) Google PAIR: Show the source for RAG 
claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces 
behind 'View Steps' toggles.
ğŸš© Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/pivot.py:)
   Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: RAG systems are 
vulnerable to 'Indirect' injections where an
attacker poisons a document to highjack the 
agent's logic during retrieval.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/pivot.py:1 |
Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening) | 
Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
ğŸš© Architectural Prompt Bloat 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/sre_a2a.py:
)
   Massive static context (>5k chars) 
detected in system instruction. This risks 
'Lost in the Middle' hallucinations.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Pivot to a RAG 
(Retrieval Augmented Generation) pattern to 
improve factual grounding accuracy.

ğŸš© Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/sre_a2a.py:
)
   Cloud Run detected. Startup Boost active.
A slow TTR makes the agent's first response 
'Dead on Arrival' for users.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Reduces TTR by 50%. 
Ensures immediate 'Latent Intelligence' 
activation.

ğŸš© Regional Proximity Breach 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/sre_a2a.py:
)
   Detected cross-region latency (>100ms). 
Reasoning (LLM) and Retrieval (Vector DB) 
must be co-located in the same zone to hit 
<10ms tail latency.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Eliminates 'Reasoning 
Drift' caused by network hops.

ğŸš© Payload Splitting (Context Fragmentation)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/sre_a2a.py:
)
   Monitor for Payload Splitting attacks 
where malicious fragments are combined over 
multiple turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement 
sliding window verification. 2) Use 'DARE 
Prompting' (Determine Appropriate Response) 
to re-evaluate intent at every turn.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Attackers can bypass 
single-turn filters by splitting a payload 
across multiple turns. Continuous monitoring
of context assembly is required.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/sre_a2a.py:1
 | Payload Splitting (Context Fragmentation)
| Monitor for Payload Splitting attacks 
where malicious fragments are combined over 
multiple turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement 
sliding window verification. 2) Use 'DARE 
Prompting' (Determine Appropriate Response) 
to re-evaluate intent at every turn.

ğŸš© Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/sre_a2a.py:
)
   For high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Single-agent loops are 
prone to hallucinations. Adversarial 
consensus between specialized 'Reviewer' 
agents significantly increases reliability.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/sre_a2a.py:1
 | Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus | 
For high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.

for standardized cross-agent memory 
handshakes.

passing. UCP reduces context-fragmentation 
and allows memory to persist across 
framework transitions.

ğŸš© LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven 
Reasoning) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/sre_a2a.py:
)
   Adopt the LlamaIndex Workflow (v0.14+) 
for event-driven agentic logic. This 
replaces rigid linear chains with a dynamic 
state-based event loop that is more 
resilient to complex user intents.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Event-driven workflows 
provide superior flexibility and error 
recovery compared to standard synchronous 
chains.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/sre_a2a.py:1
 | LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven 
Reasoning) | Adopt the LlamaIndex Workflow 
(v0.14+) for event-driven agentic logic. 
This replaces rigid linear chains with a 
dynamic state-based event loop that is more 
resilient to complex user intents.
ğŸš© Recursive Self-Improvement 
(Self-Reflexion Loops) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/sre_a2a.py:
)
   Integrate Recursive Self-Reflexion. 
Research from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that 
agents auditing their own reasoning paths 
reduce hallucination by 40%.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Ad-hoc loops lack a 
termination-of-reasoning proof. 
Standardizing on Reflexion increases 
deterministic reliability.

proves that agents auditing their own 
reasoning paths reduce hallucination by 40%.

   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Prevents vendor lock-in
and enables multi-framework swarms (e.g. 
LangChain + CrewAI).

ğŸš© Sub-Optimal Resource Profile 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/ops/auditors/base.py:)
   LLM workloads are Memory-Bound 
(KV-Cache). Low-memory instances degrade 
reasoning speed. Consider memory-optimized 
nodes (>4GB).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Maximizes Token 
Throughput by preventing memory-swapping 
during inference.

instances degrade reasoning speed. Consider

Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening) | 
Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).

not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit 
trails for all system access.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Critical for passing 
external audits and root-cause analysis.

ğŸš© Proprietary Context Handshake (Non-AP2) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:)
   Agent is using ad-hoc context passing. 
Adopting UCP (Universal Context) or AP2 
(Agent Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework 
interoperability.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Prevents vendor lock-in
and enables multi-framework swarms (e.g. 
LangChain + CrewAI).

ğŸš© Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:)
   Cloud Run detected. MISSING 
startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+ cold 
starts. A slow TTR makes the agent's first 
response 'Dead on Arrival' for users.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Reduces TTR by 50%. 
Ensures immediate 'Latent Intelligence' 
activation.

/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:1 |

detected. MISSING startup_cpu_boost. High 
risk of 10s+ cold starts. A slow TTR makes 
the agent's first response 'Dead on Arrival'
for users.

(OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the

ğŸš© Sub-Optimal Resource Profile 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:)
   LLM workloads are Memory-Bound 
(KV-Cache). Low-memory instances degrade 
reasoning speed. Consider memory-optimized 
nodes (>4GB).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Maximizes Token 
Throughput by preventing memory-swapping 
during inference.

/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:1 |

are Memory-Bound (KV-Cache). Low-memory 
instances degrade reasoning speed. Consider 
memory-optimized nodes (>4GB).
ğŸš© Missing Safety Classifiers 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:)
   Supplement prompt-based safety with 
programmatic layers: 1) Input Level: 
ShieldGemma or LLM Guard. 2) Output Level: 
Sentiment Analysis and Category Checks (GCP 
Natural Language API). 3) Persona: Tone of 
Voice controllers.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: System prompts alone 
are susceptible to jailbreaking. 
Programmatic filters provide a deterministic
safety net that cannot be 'ignored' by the 
model.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:1 | 
Missing Safety Classifiers | Supplement 
prompt-based safety with programmatic 
layers: 1) Input Level: ShieldGemma or LLM 
Guard. 2) Output Level: Sentiment Analysis 
and Category Checks (GCP Natural Language 
API). 3) Persona: Tone of Voice controllers.
ğŸš© Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP 
LLM06) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:)
   Audit tool permissions against MITRE 
ATLAS 'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) 
Granular IAM for tool execution. 2) 
Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for destructive 
actions (Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation
for Python execution.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Agents with broad tool 
access are high-value targets. Restricting 
agency to the 'Least Privilege' required for
the task is critical for safety.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:1 | 
Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP LLM06) |
Audit tool permissions against MITRE ATLAS 
'Excessive Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular 
IAM for tool execution. 2) Human-In-The-Loop
(HITL) for destructive actions 
(Delete/Write). 3) Sandbox isolation for 
Python execution.
ğŸš© Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline 11) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:)
   Ensure users understand 'Why' the agent 
took an action. Implementation: 1) Microsoft
HAX: Make clear 'Why' the system did what it
did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the source for RAG
claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces 
behind 'View Steps' toggles.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Hidden reasoning leads 
to user distrust. Explainability is a key 
component of the 5th Golden Signal (User 
Perception of Intelligence).
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:1 | 
Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline 11) | 
Ensure users understand 'Why' the agent took
an action. Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX:
Make clear 'Why' the system did what it did.
2) Google PAIR: Show the source for RAG 
claims. 3) UI: Collapse reasoning traces 
behind 'View Steps' toggles.
ğŸš© Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:)
   For high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Single-agent loops are 
prone to hallucinations. Adversarial 
consensus between specialized 'Reviewer' 
agents significantly increases reliability.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:1 | 
Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus | For 
high-stakes reasoning, move beyond 
single-shot ReAct. Implement: 1) Multi-Agent
Debate: One agent proposes, another 
critiques. 2) Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): 
Explore multiple reasoning paths. 3) 
Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own output 
before transmission.
ğŸš© Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:)
   Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: RAG systems are 
vulnerable to 'Indirect' injections where an
attacker poisons a document to highjack the 
agent's logic during retrieval.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:1 | 
Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening) | 
Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
ğŸš© Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline 01)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:)
   Don't leave users guessing. 
Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear what the 
system can do. 2) UI: Provide 'Capability 
Cards' or proactive tool suggestions. 3) 
Discovery: Show sample queries on empty 
state.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: User frustration often 
stems from 'Mental Model Mismatch' 
(expecting the agent to do things it 
cannot). Proactive disclosure of 
capabilities resolves this.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/red_team.py:1 | 
Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline 01) | 
Don't leave users guessing. Implementation: 
1) HAX: Make clear what the system can do. 
2) UI: Provide 'Capability Cards' or 
proactive tool suggestions. 3) Discovery: 
Show sample queries on empty state.

ğŸš© Orchestration Pattern Selection 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/quality_climber.py:
)
   When evaluating orchestration, consider: 
1) LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic state 
machines with persistence (checkpoints). 2) 
CrewAI: Best for role-based hierarchical 
collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer 
'Workflows over Agents' for 
high-predictability tasks.

[CONGENIAL RESEARCH SIGNAL]: Research Signal
(ArXiv): Integrate Recursive Self-Reflexion 
to reduce hallucination by 40%. (Source: 
ArXiv Intelligence Sync (Feb 2026))
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Detected custom loop 
logic. Standardized frameworks provide 
superior state management and built-in 
'Human-in-the-Loop' (HITL) pause points.
ACTION:

/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/quality_climber.py:1

ğŸš© Payload Splitting (Context Fragmentation)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/quality_climber.py:
)
   Monitor for Payload Splitting attacks 
where malicious fragments are combined over 
multiple turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement 
sliding window verification. 2) Use 'DARE 
Prompting' (Determine Appropriate Response) 
to re-evaluate intent at every turn.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Attackers can bypass 
single-turn filters by splitting a payload 
across multiple turns. Continuous monitoring
of context assembly is required.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/quality_climber.py:1
 | Payload Splitting (Context Fragmentation)
| Monitor for Payload Splitting attacks 
where malicious fragments are combined over 
multiple turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement 
sliding window verification. 2) Use 'DARE 
Prompting' (Determine Appropriate Response) 
to re-evaluate intent at every turn.
ğŸš© Agentic Observability (Golden Signals) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/quality_climber.py:
)
   Monitor the Agentic Trinity: 1) Reasoning
Trace (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to First
Token (TTFT). 3) Cost per Intent. Microsoft 
Agent Kit recommends 'Trace-based Debugging'
for multi-agent loops.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Traditional service 
metrics (CPU/RAM) aren't enough for agents. 
Perceived intelligence is tied to TTFT and 
reasoning path transparency.

Agent Kit recommends 'Trace-based Debugging'
for multi-agent loops.

ğŸš© Legacy REST vs MCP 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/load_test.py:)
   Pivot to Model Context Protocol (MCP) for
tool discovery. OpenAI, Anthropic, and 
Microsoft (Agent Kit) are converging on MCP 
for standardized tool/resource governance.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Standardized protocols 
reduce integration debt and enable 
multi-agent interoperability without custom 
bridge logic.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/load_test.py:1 |

Protocol (MCP) for tool discovery. OpenAI,

converging on MCP for standardized 
tool/resource governance.

attacker poisons a document to highjack the 
agent's logic during retrieval.
ACTION: 
/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/src
/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/load_test.py:1 | 
Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening) | 
Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
ğŸš© Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline 01)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/load_test.py:)
   Don't leave users guessing. 
Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear what the 
system can do. 2) UI: Provide 'Capability 
Cards' or proactive tool suggestions. 3) 
Discovery: Show sample queries on empty 
state.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: User frustration often 
stems from 'Mental Model Mismatch' 
(expecting the agent to do things it 
cannot). Proactive disclosure of 
capabilities resolves this.

Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline 01) | 
Don't leave users guessing. Implementation: 
1) HAX: Make clear what the system can do. 
2) UI: Provide 'Capability Cards' or 
proactive tool suggestions. 3) Discovery: 
Show sample queries on empty state.

   Structural logging (logger.info/error) 
not detected. SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit 
trails for all system access.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Critical for passing 
external audits and root-cause analysis.

ğŸš© Proprietary Context Handshake (Non-AP2) 
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/__init__.py:)
   Agent is using ad-hoc context passing. 
Adopting UCP (Universal Context) or AP2 
(Agent Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework 
interoperability.
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: Prevents vendor lock-in
and enables multi-framework swarms (e.g. 
LangChain + CrewAI).

Agent is using ad-hoc context passing. 
Adopting UCP (Universal Context) or AP2 
(Agent Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework 
interoperability.

(OTEL/Cloud Trace) not detected. TTFT is the

'Latency Regression' alerts before users

ğŸš© Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening)
(/Users/enriq/Documents/git/agent-cockpit/sr
c/agent_ops_cockpit/eval/__init__.py:)
   Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).
   âš–ï¸ Strategic ROI: RAG systems are 
vulnerable to 'Indirect' injections where an
attacker poisons a document to highjack the 
agent's logic during retrieval.

Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG Hardening) | 
Protect the RAG pipeline. Implement: 1) 
Input Sanitization for 'Malicious Fragments'
in fetched docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts
that forbid following instructions found in 
retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM verification 
(Small model scans retrieval context before 
the Large model sees it).

â”‚ ğŸŒŠ Impact Waterfall (v1.3)               â”‚
â”‚                                          â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Reasoning Delay: 1600ms added to      â”‚
â”‚    chain (Critical Path).                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Risk Reduction: 5016% reduction in    â”‚
â”‚    Potential Failure Points (PFPs) via   â”‚
â”‚    audit logic.                          â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sovereignty Delta: 0/100 - (ğŸš¨        â”‚
â”‚    EXIT_PLAN_REQUIRED).                  â”‚
â”‚                                          â”‚
â”‚ ğŸ› ï¸ Summary of Findings                   â”‚
â”‚                                          â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Vendor Lock-in Risk: Hardcoded GCP    â”‚
â”‚    Project ID. Use environment variables â”‚
â”‚    for portability. (Impact: MEDIUM)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Direct Vendor SDK Exposure: Directly  â”‚
â”‚    importing 'vertexai'. Consider        â”‚
â”‚    wrapping in a provider-agnostic       â”‚
â”‚    bridge to allow Multi-Cloud mobility. â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: LOW)                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Strategic Exit Plan (Cloud): Detected â”‚
â”‚    hardcoded cloud dependencies. For a   â”‚
â”‚    'Category Killer' grade, implement an â”‚
â”‚    abstraction layer that allows         â”‚
â”‚    switching to Gemma 2 on GKE. (Impact: â”‚
â”‚    INFO)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop:       â”‚
â”‚    Detected a self-referencing agent     â”‚
â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline  â”‚
â”‚    11): Ensure users understand 'Why'    â”‚
â”‚    the agent took an action.             â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX:     â”‚
â”‚    Make clear 'Why' the system did what  â”‚
â”‚    it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the      â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI:         â”‚
â”‚    Collapse reasoning traces behind      â”‚
â”‚    'View Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: â”‚
â”‚    For high-stakes reasoning, move       â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent      â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2)       â”‚
â”‚    Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore       â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3)          â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own  â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake         â”‚
â”‚    (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc      â”‚
â”‚    context passing. Adopting UCP         â”‚
â”‚    (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent     â”‚
â”‚    Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework  â”‚
â”‚    interoperability. (Impact: LOW)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Orchestration Pattern Selection: When â”‚
â”‚    evaluating orchestration, consider:   â”‚
â”‚    1) LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic  â”‚
â”‚    state machines with persistence       â”‚
â”‚    (checkpoints). 2) CrewAI: Best for    â”‚
â”‚    role-based hierarchical               â”‚
â”‚    collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer   â”‚
â”‚    'Workflows over Agents' for           â”‚
â”‚    high-predictability tasks.            â”‚
â”‚                                          â”‚
â”‚ [CONGENIAL RESEARCH SIGNAL]: Research    â”‚
â”‚ Signal (ArXiv): Integrate Recursive      â”‚
â”‚ Self-Reflexion to reduce hallucination   â”‚
â”‚ by 40%. (Source: ArXiv Intelligence Sync â”‚
â”‚ (Feb 2026)) (Impact: MEDIUM)             â”‚
â”‚                                          â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming):    â”‚
â”‚    Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)     â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety â”‚
â”‚    (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive       â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic â”‚
â”‚    (Canned response check). 5) Language  â”‚
â”‚    (Non-supported language override).    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: HIGH)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: â”‚
â”‚    For high-stakes reasoning, move       â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent      â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2)       â”‚
â”‚    Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore       â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3)          â”‚

â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚

â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for  â”‚

â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚

â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚

â”‚    k. Benefits: 1) Pre-built LangGraph   â”‚
â”‚    patterns. 2) IAM-hardened             â”‚
â”‚    deployments. 3) Standardized tool-use â”‚
â”‚    hooks. (Impact: HIGH)                 â”‚

â”‚    (Self-Reflexion Loops): Integrate     â”‚
â”‚    Recursive Self-Reflexion. Research    â”‚
â”‚    from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths    â”‚
â”‚    reduce hallucination by 40%. (Impact: â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                             â”‚

â”‚    both LangGraph and CrewAI. Using two  â”‚
â”‚    loop managers is a 'High-Entropy'     â”‚
â”‚    pattern that often leads to cyclic    â”‚
â”‚    state deadlocks. (Impact: HIGH)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Version Drift Conflict Detected:      â”‚

â”‚    langchain and crewai. Breaking change â”‚
â”‚    in BaseCallbackHandler. Expect        â”‚
â”‚    runtime crashes during tool           â”‚
â”‚    execution. (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚

â”‚  â€¢ Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP   â”‚
â”‚    LLM06): Audit tool permissions        â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive        â”‚
â”‚    Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM   â”‚
â”‚    for tool execution. 2)                â”‚
â”‚    Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for          â”‚
â”‚    destructive actions (Delete/Write).   â”‚
â”‚    3) Sandbox isolation for Python       â”‚
â”‚    execution. (Impact: CRITICAL)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agent Starter Pack Template Adoption: â”‚

â”‚    k. Benefits: 1) Pre-built LangGraph   â”‚
â”‚    patterns. 2) IAM-hardened             â”‚
â”‚    deployments. 3) Standardized tool-use â”‚
â”‚    hooks. (Impact: HIGH)                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven    â”‚
â”‚    Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex      â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven    â”‚
â”‚    agentic logic. This replaces rigid    â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic          â”‚
â”‚    state-based event loop that is more   â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: HIGH)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Incompatible Duo: langgraph + crewai: â”‚
â”‚    CrewAI and LangGraph both attempt to  â”‚
â”‚    manage the orchestration loop and     â”‚
â”‚    state, leading to cyclic-dependency   â”‚
â”‚    conflicts. (Impact: CRITICAL)         â”‚

â”‚    empty state. (Impact: MEDIUM)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Vendor Lock-in Risk: Hardcoded GCP    â”‚
â”‚    Project ID. Use environment variables â”‚
â”‚    for portability. (Impact: MEDIUM)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop:       â”‚
â”‚    Detected a self-referencing agent     â”‚
â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Legacy REST vs MCP: Pivot to Model    â”‚
â”‚    Context Protocol (MCP) for tool       â”‚
â”‚    discovery. OpenAI, Anthropic, and     â”‚
â”‚    Microsoft (Agent Kit) are converging  â”‚
â”‚    on MCP for standardized tool/resource â”‚
â”‚    governance. (Impact: HIGH)            â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Enterprise Identity (Identity         â”‚
â”‚    Sprawl): Move beyond static keys.     â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) GCP: Workload Identity  â”‚
â”‚    Federation. 2) AWS: Private VPC       â”‚
â”‚    Endpoints + IAM Role-based access. 3) â”‚
â”‚    Azure: Managed Identities for all     â”‚
â”‚    tool interactions. (Impact: CRITICAL) â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline  â”‚
â”‚    11): Ensure users understand 'Why'    â”‚
â”‚    the agent took an action.             â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX:     â”‚
â”‚    Make clear 'Why' the system did what  â”‚
â”‚    it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the      â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI:         â”‚
â”‚    Collapse reasoning traces behind      â”‚
â”‚    'View Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: â”‚
â”‚    For high-stakes reasoning, move       â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent      â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2)       â”‚
â”‚    Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore       â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3)          â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own  â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agent Starter Pack Template Adoption: â”‚
â”‚    Leverage production-grade Generative  â”‚
â”‚    AI templates from the                 â”‚
â”‚    GoogleCloudPlatform/agent-starter-pac â”‚
â”‚    k. Benefits: 1) Pre-built LangGraph   â”‚
â”‚    patterns. 2) IAM-hardened             â”‚
â”‚    deployments. 3) Standardized tool-use â”‚
â”‚    hooks. (Impact: HIGH)                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Structured Output Enforcement:        â”‚
â”‚    Eliminate parsing failures. 1)        â”‚
â”‚    OpenAI: Use 'Structured Outputs' for  â”‚
â”‚    guaranteed schema. 2) GCP:            â”‚
â”‚    Application Mimetype                  â”‚
â”‚    (application/json) enforcement. 3)    â”‚
â”‚    LangGraph: Pydantic-based state       â”‚
â”‚    validation. (Impact: MEDIUM)          â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
