â”‚  â€¢ Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP   â”‚
â”‚    LLM06): Audit tool permissions        â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive        â”‚
â”‚    Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM   â”‚
â”‚    for tool execution. 2)                â”‚
â”‚    Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for          â”‚
â”‚    destructive actions (Delete/Write).   â”‚
â”‚    3) Sandbox isolation for Python       â”‚
â”‚    execution. (Impact: CRITICAL)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: â”‚
â”‚    For high-stakes reasoning, move       â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent      â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2)       â”‚
â”‚    Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore       â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3)          â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own  â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG        â”‚
â”‚    Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline. â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for  â”‚
â”‚    'Malicious Fragments' in fetched      â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM  â”‚
â”‚    verification (Small model scans       â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven    â”‚
â”‚    Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex      â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven    â”‚
â”‚    agentic logic. This replaces rigid    â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic          â”‚
â”‚    state-based event loop that is more   â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: HIGH)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Recursive Self-Improvement            â”‚
â”‚    (Self-Reflexion Loops): Integrate     â”‚
â”‚    Recursive Self-Reflexion. Research    â”‚
â”‚    from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths    â”‚
â”‚    reduce hallucination by 40%. (Impact: â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ HIPAA Risk: Potential Unencrypted     â”‚
â”‚    ePHI: Database interaction detected   â”‚
â”‚    without explicit encryption or secret â”‚
â”‚    management headers. (Impact:          â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop:       â”‚
â”‚    Detected a self-referencing agent     â”‚
â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming):    â”‚
â”‚    Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)     â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety â”‚
â”‚    (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive       â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic â”‚
â”‚    (Canned response check). 5) Language  â”‚
â”‚    (Non-supported language override).    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: HIGH)                        â”‚

â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on       â”‚
â”‚    Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)    â”‚

â”‚    degrade reasoning speed. Consider     â”‚
â”‚    memory-optimized nodes (>4GB).        â”‚

â”‚    context passing. Adopting UCP         â”‚
â”‚    (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent     â”‚

â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for  â”‚

â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚

â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Strategic Conflict:                   â”‚
â”‚    Multi-Orchestrator Setup: Detected    â”‚
â”‚    both LangGraph and CrewAI. Using two  â”‚
â”‚    loop managers is a 'High-Entropy'     â”‚
â”‚    pattern that often leads to cyclic    â”‚
â”‚    state deadlocks. (Impact: HIGH)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Architectural Prompt Bloat: Massive   â”‚
â”‚    static context (>5k chars) detected   â”‚
â”‚    in system instruction. This risks     â”‚
â”‚    'Lost in the Middle' hallucinations.  â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚

â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sub-Optimal Vector Networking (REST): â”‚
â”‚    Detected REST-based vector retrieval. â”‚
â”‚    High-concurrency agents should use    â”‚
â”‚    gRPC to reduce 'Cognitive Tax' by 40% â”‚
â”‚    and prevent tail-latency spikes.      â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk: Cloud   â”‚
â”‚    Run detected. MISSING                 â”‚
â”‚    startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+  â”‚
â”‚    cold starts. A slow TTR makes the     â”‚
â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on       â”‚
â”‚    Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚

â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sub-Optimal Resource Profile: LLM     â”‚
â”‚    workloads are Memory-Bound            â”‚
â”‚    (KV-Cache). Low-memory instances      â”‚
â”‚    degrade reasoning speed. Consider     â”‚
â”‚    memory-optimized nodes (>4GB).        â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: LOW)                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sovereign Model Migration             â”‚
â”‚    Opportunity: Detected OpenAI          â”‚
â”‚    dependency. For maximum Data          â”‚
â”‚    Sovereignty and 40% TCO reduction,    â”‚
â”‚    consider pivoting to Gemma2 or        â”‚
â”‚    Llama3-70B on Vertex AI Prediction    â”‚
â”‚    endpoints. (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Compute Scaling Optimization:         â”‚
â”‚    Detected complex scaling logic. If    â”‚
â”‚    traffic exceeds 10k RPS, consider     â”‚
â”‚    pivoting from Cloud Run to GKE with   â”‚
â”‚    Anthos for hybrid-cloud sovereignty.  â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: INFO)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Vector Store Evolution (Chroma DB):   â”‚
â”‚    For enterprise scaling, evaluate: 1)  â”‚
â”‚    Google Cloud: Vertex AI Search for    â”‚
â”‚    handled grounding. 2) AWS: Amazon     â”‚
â”‚    Bedrock Knowledge Bases. 3) General:  â”‚
â”‚    BigQuery Vector Search for high-scale â”‚
â”‚    analytical joins. (Impact: HIGH)      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming):    â”‚
â”‚    Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)     â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety â”‚
â”‚    (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive       â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic â”‚
â”‚    (Canned response check). 5) Language  â”‚
â”‚    (Non-supported language override).    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: HIGH)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agentic Observability (Golden         â”‚
â”‚    Signals): Monitor the Agentic         â”‚
â”‚    Trinity: 1) Reasoning Trace           â”‚
â”‚    (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to      â”‚
â”‚    First Token (TTFT). 3) Cost per       â”‚
â”‚    Intent. Microsoft Agent Kit           â”‚
â”‚    recommends 'Trace-based Debugging'    â”‚
â”‚    for multi-agent loops. (Impact:       â”‚
â”‚    MEDIUM)                               â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP   â”‚
â”‚    LLM06): Audit tool permissions        â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive        â”‚
â”‚    Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM   â”‚
â”‚    for tool execution. 2)                â”‚
â”‚    Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for          â”‚
â”‚    destructive actions (Delete/Write).   â”‚
â”‚    3) Sandbox isolation for Python       â”‚
â”‚    execution. (Impact: CRITICAL)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline  â”‚
â”‚    11): Ensure users understand 'Why'    â”‚
â”‚    the agent took an action.             â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX:     â”‚
â”‚    Make clear 'Why' the system did what  â”‚
â”‚    it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the      â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI:         â”‚
â”‚    Collapse reasoning traces behind      â”‚
â”‚    'View Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: â”‚
â”‚    For high-stakes reasoning, move       â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent      â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2)       â”‚
â”‚    Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore       â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3)          â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own  â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG        â”‚
â”‚    Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline. â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for  â”‚
â”‚    'Malicious Fragments' in fetched      â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM  â”‚
â”‚    verification (Small model scans       â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline â”‚
â”‚    01): Don't leave users guessing.      â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear    â”‚
â”‚    what the system can do. 2) UI:        â”‚
â”‚    Provide 'Capability Cards' or         â”‚
â”‚    proactive tool suggestions. 3)        â”‚
â”‚    Discovery: Show sample queries on     â”‚
â”‚    empty state. (Impact: MEDIUM)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agent Starter Pack Template Adoption: â”‚
â”‚    Leverage production-grade Generative  â”‚
â”‚    AI templates from the                 â”‚
â”‚    GoogleCloudPlatform/agent-starter-pac â”‚
â”‚    k. Benefits: 1) Pre-built LangGraph   â”‚
â”‚    patterns. 2) IAM-hardened             â”‚
â”‚    deployments. 3) Standardized tool-use â”‚
â”‚    hooks. (Impact: HIGH)                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven    â”‚
â”‚    Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex      â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven    â”‚
â”‚    agentic logic. This replaces rigid    â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic          â”‚
â”‚    state-based event loop that is more   â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: HIGH)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Recursive Self-Improvement            â”‚
â”‚    (Self-Reflexion Loops): Integrate     â”‚
â”‚    Recursive Self-Reflexion. Research    â”‚
â”‚    from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths    â”‚
â”‚    reduce hallucination by 40%. (Impact: â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Incompatible Duo: langgraph + crewai: â”‚
â”‚    CrewAI and LangGraph both attempt to  â”‚
â”‚    manage the orchestration loop and     â”‚
â”‚    state, leading to cyclic-dependency   â”‚
â”‚    conflicts. (Impact: CRITICAL)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop:       â”‚
â”‚    Detected a self-referencing agent     â”‚
â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake         â”‚
â”‚    (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc      â”‚
â”‚    context passing. Adopting UCP         â”‚
â”‚    (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent     â”‚
â”‚    Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework  â”‚
â”‚    interoperability. (Impact: LOW)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk: Cloud   â”‚
â”‚    Run detected. MISSING                 â”‚
â”‚    startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+  â”‚
â”‚    cold starts. A slow TTR makes the     â”‚
â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on       â”‚
â”‚    Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sub-Optimal Resource Profile: LLM     â”‚
â”‚    workloads are Memory-Bound            â”‚
â”‚    (KV-Cache). Low-memory instances      â”‚
â”‚    degrade reasoning speed. Consider     â”‚
â”‚    memory-optimized nodes (>4GB).        â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: LOW)                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Orchestration Pattern Selection: When â”‚
â”‚    evaluating orchestration, consider:   â”‚
â”‚    1) LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic  â”‚
â”‚    state machines with persistence       â”‚
â”‚    (checkpoints). 2) CrewAI: Best for    â”‚
â”‚    role-based hierarchical               â”‚
â”‚    collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer   â”‚
â”‚    'Workflows over Agents' for           â”‚
â”‚    high-predictability tasks.            â”‚
â”‚                                          â”‚
â”‚ [CONGENIAL RESEARCH SIGNAL]: Research    â”‚

â”‚ by 40%. (Source: ArXiv Intelligence Sync â”‚

â”‚  â€¢ Payload Splitting (Context            â”‚
â”‚    Fragmentation): Monitor for Payload   â”‚
â”‚    Splitting attacks where malicious     â”‚
â”‚    fragments are combined over multiple  â”‚
â”‚    turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement       â”‚
â”‚    sliding window verification. 2) Use   â”‚
â”‚    'DARE Prompting' (Determine           â”‚
â”‚    Appropriate Response) to re-evaluate  â”‚
â”‚    intent at every turn. (Impact: HIGH)  â”‚

â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚

â”‚    context passing. Adopting UCP         â”‚
â”‚    (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent     â”‚
â”‚    Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework  â”‚
â”‚    interoperability. (Impact: LOW)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Short-Term Memory (STM) at Risk:      â”‚
â”‚    Agent is storing session state in     â”‚
â”‚    local pod memory (dictionaries). A    â”‚
â”‚    GKE restart or Cloud Run scale-down   â”‚
â”‚    wipes the agent's brain. (Impact:     â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agentic Observability (Golden         â”‚
â”‚    Signals): Monitor the Agentic         â”‚
â”‚    Trinity: 1) Reasoning Trace           â”‚
â”‚    (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to      â”‚
â”‚    First Token (TTFT). 3) Cost per       â”‚
â”‚    Intent. Microsoft Agent Kit           â”‚
â”‚    recommends 'Trace-based Debugging'    â”‚
â”‚    for multi-agent loops. (Impact:       â”‚
â”‚    MEDIUM)                               â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP   â”‚
â”‚    LLM06): Audit tool permissions        â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive        â”‚
â”‚    Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM   â”‚
â”‚    for tool execution. 2)                â”‚
â”‚    Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for          â”‚
â”‚    destructive actions (Delete/Write).   â”‚
â”‚    3) Sandbox isolation for Python       â”‚
â”‚    execution. (Impact: CRITICAL)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: â”‚
â”‚    For high-stakes reasoning, move       â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent      â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2)       â”‚
â”‚    Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore       â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3)          â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own  â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG        â”‚
â”‚    Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline. â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for  â”‚
â”‚    'Malicious Fragments' in fetched      â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM  â”‚
â”‚    verification (Small model scans       â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Architectural Prompt Bloat: Massive   â”‚
â”‚    static context (>5k chars) detected   â”‚
â”‚    in system instruction. This risks     â”‚
â”‚    'Lost in the Middle' hallucinations.  â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ HIPAA Risk: Potential Unencrypted     â”‚
â”‚    ePHI: Database interaction detected   â”‚
â”‚    without explicit encryption or secret â”‚
â”‚    management headers. (Impact:          â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop:       â”‚
â”‚    Detected a self-referencing agent     â”‚
â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake         â”‚
â”‚    (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc      â”‚
â”‚    context passing. Adopting UCP         â”‚
â”‚    (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent     â”‚
â”‚    Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework  â”‚
â”‚    interoperability. (Impact: LOW)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Orchestration Pattern Selection: When â”‚
â”‚    evaluating orchestration, consider:   â”‚
â”‚    1) LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic  â”‚
â”‚    state machines with persistence       â”‚
â”‚    (checkpoints). 2) CrewAI: Best for    â”‚
â”‚    role-based hierarchical               â”‚
â”‚    collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer   â”‚
â”‚    'Workflows over Agents' for           â”‚
â”‚    high-predictability tasks.            â”‚
â”‚                                          â”‚
â”‚ [CONGENIAL RESEARCH SIGNAL]: Research    â”‚
â”‚ Signal (ArXiv): Integrate Recursive      â”‚
â”‚ Self-Reflexion to reduce hallucination   â”‚
â”‚ by 40%. (Source: ArXiv Intelligence Sync â”‚
â”‚ (Feb 2026)) (Impact: MEDIUM)             â”‚
â”‚                                          â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming):    â”‚
â”‚    Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)     â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety â”‚
â”‚    (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive       â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic â”‚
â”‚    (Canned response check). 5) Language  â”‚
â”‚    (Non-supported language override).    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: HIGH)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline  â”‚
â”‚    11): Ensure users understand 'Why'    â”‚
â”‚    the agent took an action.             â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX:     â”‚
â”‚    Make clear 'Why' the system did what  â”‚
â”‚    it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the      â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI:         â”‚
â”‚    Collapse reasoning traces behind      â”‚
â”‚    'View Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: â”‚
â”‚    For high-stakes reasoning, move       â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent      â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2)       â”‚
â”‚    Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore       â”‚

â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact:  â”‚

â”‚    Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear    â”‚
â”‚    what the system can do. 2) UI:        â”‚
â”‚    Provide 'Capability Cards' or         â”‚
â”‚    proactive tool suggestions. 3)        â”‚
â”‚    Discovery: Show sample queries on     â”‚
â”‚    empty state. (Impact: MEDIUM)         â”‚

â”‚    (Self-Reflexion Loops): Integrate     â”‚
â”‚    Recursive Self-Reflexion. Research    â”‚
â”‚    from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths    â”‚
â”‚    reduce hallucination by 40%. (Impact: â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                             â”‚

â”‚    is returning raw HTML/UI strings      â”‚
â”‚    without A2UI surfaceId mapping. This  â”‚

â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop:       â”‚
â”‚    Detected a self-referencing agent     â”‚
â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk: Cloud   â”‚
â”‚    Run detected. MISSING                 â”‚
â”‚    startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+  â”‚
â”‚    cold starts. A slow TTR makes the     â”‚
â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on       â”‚
â”‚    Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sub-Optimal Resource Profile: LLM     â”‚
â”‚    workloads are Memory-Bound            â”‚
â”‚    (KV-Cache). Low-memory instances      â”‚
â”‚    degrade reasoning speed. Consider     â”‚
â”‚    memory-optimized nodes (>4GB).        â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: LOW)                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming):    â”‚
â”‚    Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)     â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety â”‚
â”‚    (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive       â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic â”‚
â”‚    (Canned response check). 5) Language  â”‚
â”‚    (Non-supported language override).    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: HIGH)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Structured Output Enforcement:        â”‚
â”‚    Eliminate parsing failures. 1)        â”‚
â”‚    OpenAI: Use 'Structured Outputs' for  â”‚
â”‚    guaranteed schema. 2) GCP:            â”‚
â”‚    Application Mimetype                  â”‚
â”‚    (application/json) enforcement. 3)    â”‚
â”‚    LangGraph: Pydantic-based state       â”‚
â”‚    validation. (Impact: MEDIUM)          â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: â”‚
â”‚    For high-stakes reasoning, move       â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent      â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2)       â”‚
â”‚    Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore       â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3)          â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own  â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG        â”‚
â”‚    Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline. â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for  â”‚
â”‚    'Malicious Fragments' in fetched      â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM  â”‚
â”‚    verification (Small model scans       â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Architectural Prompt Bloat: Massive   â”‚
â”‚    static context (>5k chars) detected   â”‚
â”‚    in system instruction. This risks     â”‚
â”‚    'Lost in the Middle' hallucinations.  â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ HIPAA Risk: Potential Unencrypted     â”‚
â”‚    ePHI: Database interaction detected   â”‚
â”‚    without explicit encryption or secret â”‚
â”‚    management headers. (Impact:          â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake         â”‚
â”‚    (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc      â”‚
â”‚    context passing. Adopting UCP         â”‚
â”‚    (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent     â”‚
â”‚    Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework  â”‚
â”‚    interoperability. (Impact: LOW)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk: Cloud   â”‚
â”‚    Run detected. MISSING                 â”‚
â”‚    startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+  â”‚
â”‚    cold starts. A slow TTR makes the     â”‚
â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on       â”‚
â”‚    Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sub-Optimal Resource Profile: LLM     â”‚
â”‚    workloads are Memory-Bound            â”‚
â”‚    (KV-Cache). Low-memory instances      â”‚
â”‚    degrade reasoning speed. Consider     â”‚
â”‚    memory-optimized nodes (>4GB).        â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: LOW)                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Orchestration Pattern Selection: When â”‚
â”‚    evaluating orchestration, consider:   â”‚
â”‚    1) LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic  â”‚
â”‚    state machines with persistence       â”‚
â”‚    (checkpoints). 2) CrewAI: Best for    â”‚
â”‚    role-based hierarchical               â”‚
â”‚    collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer   â”‚
â”‚    'Workflows over Agents' for           â”‚
â”‚    high-predictability tasks.            â”‚
â”‚                                          â”‚
â”‚ [CONGENIAL RESEARCH SIGNAL]: Research    â”‚
â”‚ Signal (ArXiv): Integrate Recursive      â”‚
â”‚ Self-Reflexion to reduce hallucination   â”‚
â”‚ by 40%. (Source: ArXiv Intelligence Sync â”‚
â”‚ (Feb 2026)) (Impact: MEDIUM)             â”‚
â”‚                                          â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Structured Output Enforcement:        â”‚
â”‚    Eliminate parsing failures. 1)        â”‚
â”‚    OpenAI: Use 'Structured Outputs' for  â”‚
â”‚    guaranteed schema. 2) GCP:            â”‚
â”‚    Application Mimetype                  â”‚
â”‚    (application/json) enforcement. 3)    â”‚
â”‚    LangGraph: Pydantic-based state       â”‚
â”‚    validation. (Impact: MEDIUM)          â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agentic Observability (Golden         â”‚
â”‚    Signals): Monitor the Agentic         â”‚
â”‚    Trinity: 1) Reasoning Trace           â”‚
â”‚    (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to      â”‚
â”‚    First Token (TTFT). 3) Cost per       â”‚
â”‚    Intent. Microsoft Agent Kit           â”‚
â”‚    recommends 'Trace-based Debugging'    â”‚
â”‚    for multi-agent loops. (Impact:       â”‚
â”‚    MEDIUM)                               â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline  â”‚
â”‚    11): Ensure users understand 'Why'    â”‚
â”‚    the agent took an action.             â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX:     â”‚
â”‚    Make clear 'Why' the system did what  â”‚
â”‚    it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the      â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI:         â”‚
â”‚    Collapse reasoning traces behind      â”‚
â”‚    'View Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG        â”‚
â”‚    Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline. â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for  â”‚
â”‚    'Malicious Fragments' in fetched      â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM  â”‚
â”‚    verification (Small model scans       â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline â”‚
â”‚    01): Don't leave users guessing.      â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear    â”‚
â”‚    what the system can do. 2) UI:        â”‚
â”‚    Provide 'Capability Cards' or         â”‚
â”‚    proactive tool suggestions. 3)        â”‚
â”‚    Discovery: Show sample queries on     â”‚
â”‚    empty state. (Impact: MEDIUM)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven    â”‚
â”‚    Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex      â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven    â”‚
â”‚    agentic logic. This replaces rigid    â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic          â”‚
â”‚    state-based event loop that is more   â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: HIGH)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Recursive Self-Improvement            â”‚
â”‚    (Self-Reflexion Loops): Integrate     â”‚
â”‚    Recursive Self-Reflexion. Research    â”‚
â”‚    from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths    â”‚
â”‚    reduce hallucination by 40%. (Impact: â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Architectural Prompt Bloat: Massive   â”‚
â”‚    static context (>5k chars) detected   â”‚
â”‚    in system instruction. This risks     â”‚
â”‚    'Lost in the Middle' hallucinations.  â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ HIPAA Risk: Potential Unencrypted     â”‚
â”‚    ePHI: Database interaction detected   â”‚
â”‚    without explicit encryption or secret â”‚
â”‚    management headers. (Impact:          â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop:       â”‚
â”‚    Detected a self-referencing agent     â”‚
â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing GenUI Surface Mapping: Agent  â”‚
â”‚    is returning raw HTML/UI strings      â”‚
â”‚    without A2UI surfaceId mapping. This  â”‚
â”‚    breaks the 'Push-based GenUI'         â”‚
â”‚    standard. (Impact: HIGH)              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake         â”‚
â”‚    (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc      â”‚
â”‚    context passing. Adopting UCP         â”‚
â”‚    (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent     â”‚
â”‚    Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework  â”‚
â”‚    interoperability. (Impact: LOW)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk: Cloud   â”‚
â”‚    Run detected. MISSING                 â”‚

â”‚    cold starts. A slow TTR makes the     â”‚
â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on       â”‚
â”‚    Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)    â”‚

â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚

â”‚    guaranteed schema. 2) GCP:            â”‚

â”‚    Signals): Monitor the Agentic         â”‚
â”‚    Trinity: 1) Reasoning Trace           â”‚
â”‚    (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to      â”‚

â”‚  â€¢ Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP   â”‚
â”‚    LLM06): Audit tool permissions        â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive        â”‚
â”‚    Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM   â”‚
â”‚    for tool execution. 2)                â”‚
â”‚    Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for          â”‚
â”‚    destructive actions (Delete/Write).   â”‚
â”‚    3) Sandbox isolation for Python       â”‚
â”‚    execution. (Impact: CRITICAL)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline  â”‚
â”‚    11): Ensure users understand 'Why'    â”‚
â”‚    the agent took an action.             â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX:     â”‚

â”‚    it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the      â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI:         â”‚

â”‚    'View Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)  â”‚

â”‚    LLM06): Audit tool permissions        â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive        â”‚
â”‚    Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM   â”‚
â”‚    for tool execution. 2)                â”‚
â”‚    Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for          â”‚
â”‚    destructive actions (Delete/Write).   â”‚
â”‚    3) Sandbox isolation for Python       â”‚
â”‚    execution. (Impact: CRITICAL)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG        â”‚
â”‚    Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline. â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for  â”‚
â”‚    'Malicious Fragments' in fetched      â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM  â”‚
â”‚    verification (Small model scans       â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop:       â”‚
â”‚    Detected a self-referencing agent     â”‚
â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake         â”‚
â”‚    (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc      â”‚
â”‚    context passing. Adopting UCP         â”‚
â”‚    (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent     â”‚
â”‚    Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework  â”‚
â”‚    interoperability. (Impact: LOW)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG        â”‚
â”‚    Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline. â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for  â”‚
â”‚    'Malicious Fragments' in fetched      â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM  â”‚
â”‚    verification (Small model scans       â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Schema-less A2A Handshake:            â”‚
â”‚    Agent-to-Agent call detected without  â”‚
â”‚    explicit input/output schema          â”‚
â”‚    validation. High risk of 'Reasoning   â”‚
â”‚    Drift'. (Impact: HIGH)                â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop:       â”‚
â”‚    Detected a self-referencing agent     â”‚
â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake         â”‚
â”‚    (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc      â”‚
â”‚    context passing. Adopting UCP         â”‚
â”‚    (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent     â”‚
â”‚    Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework  â”‚
â”‚    interoperability. (Impact: LOW)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Enterprise Identity (Identity         â”‚
â”‚    Sprawl): Move beyond static keys.     â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) GCP: Workload Identity  â”‚
â”‚    Federation. 2) AWS: Private VPC       â”‚
â”‚    Endpoints + IAM Role-based access. 3) â”‚
â”‚    Azure: Managed Identities for all     â”‚
â”‚    tool interactions. (Impact: CRITICAL) â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing Safety Classifiers:           â”‚
â”‚    Supplement prompt-based safety with   â”‚
â”‚    programmatic layers: 1) Input Level:  â”‚
â”‚    ShieldGemma or LLM Guard. 2) Output   â”‚
â”‚    Level: Sentiment Analysis and         â”‚
â”‚    Category Checks (GCP Natural Language â”‚
â”‚    API). 3) Persona: Tone of Voice       â”‚
â”‚    controllers. (Impact: HIGH)           â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: â”‚
â”‚    For high-stakes reasoning, move       â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent      â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2)       â”‚
â”‚    Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore       â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3)          â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own  â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG        â”‚
â”‚    Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline. â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for  â”‚
â”‚    'Malicious Fragments' in fetched      â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM  â”‚
â”‚    verification (Small model scans       â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Architectural Prompt Bloat: Massive   â”‚
â”‚    static context (>5k chars) detected   â”‚
â”‚    in system instruction. This risks     â”‚
â”‚    'Lost in the Middle' hallucinations.  â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Ungated External Communication        â”‚
â”‚    Action: Function 'send_email_report'  â”‚
â”‚    performs a high-risk action but lacks â”‚
â”‚    a 'human_approval' flag or security   â”‚
â”‚    gate. (Impact: CRITICAL)              â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop:       â”‚
â”‚    Detected a self-referencing agent     â”‚
â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk: Cloud   â”‚
â”‚    Run detected. MISSING                 â”‚
â”‚    startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+  â”‚
â”‚    cold starts. A slow TTR makes the     â”‚
â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on       â”‚
â”‚    Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sub-Optimal Resource Profile: LLM     â”‚
â”‚    workloads are Memory-Bound            â”‚
â”‚    (KV-Cache). Low-memory instances      â”‚
â”‚    degrade reasoning speed. Consider     â”‚
â”‚    memory-optimized nodes (>4GB).        â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: LOW)                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Enterprise Identity (Identity         â”‚
â”‚    Sprawl): Move beyond static keys.     â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) GCP: Workload Identity  â”‚
â”‚    Federation. 2) AWS: Private VPC       â”‚
â”‚    Endpoints + IAM Role-based access. 3) â”‚
â”‚    Azure: Managed Identities for all     â”‚
â”‚    tool interactions. (Impact: CRITICAL) â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Orchestration Pattern Selection: When â”‚
â”‚    evaluating orchestration, consider:   â”‚
â”‚    1) LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic  â”‚
â”‚    state machines with persistence       â”‚
â”‚    (checkpoints). 2) CrewAI: Best for    â”‚
â”‚    role-based hierarchical               â”‚
â”‚    collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer   â”‚
â”‚    'Workflows over Agents' for           â”‚
â”‚    high-predictability tasks.            â”‚
â”‚                                          â”‚
â”‚ [CONGENIAL RESEARCH SIGNAL]: Research    â”‚
â”‚ Signal (ArXiv): Integrate Recursive      â”‚
â”‚ Self-Reflexion to reduce hallucination   â”‚
â”‚ by 40%. (Source: ArXiv Intelligence Sync â”‚
â”‚ (Feb 2026)) (Impact: MEDIUM)             â”‚
â”‚                                          â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming):    â”‚
â”‚    Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)     â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety â”‚
â”‚    (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive       â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic â”‚
â”‚    (Canned response check). 5) Language  â”‚
â”‚    (Non-supported language override).    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: HIGH)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Structured Output Enforcement:        â”‚
â”‚    Eliminate parsing failures. 1)        â”‚
â”‚    OpenAI: Use 'Structured Outputs' for  â”‚
â”‚    guaranteed schema. 2) GCP:            â”‚
â”‚    Application Mimetype                  â”‚
â”‚    (application/json) enforcement. 3)    â”‚
â”‚    LangGraph: Pydantic-based state       â”‚
â”‚    validation. (Impact: MEDIUM)          â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agentic Observability (Golden         â”‚
â”‚    Signals): Monitor the Agentic         â”‚
â”‚    Trinity: 1) Reasoning Trace           â”‚
â”‚    (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to      â”‚
â”‚    First Token (TTFT). 3) Cost per       â”‚
â”‚    Intent. Microsoft Agent Kit           â”‚
â”‚    recommends 'Trace-based Debugging'    â”‚
â”‚    for multi-agent loops. (Impact:       â”‚
â”‚    MEDIUM)                               â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP   â”‚
â”‚    LLM06): Audit tool permissions        â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive        â”‚
â”‚    Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM   â”‚
â”‚    for tool execution. 2)                â”‚
â”‚    Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for          â”‚
â”‚    destructive actions (Delete/Write).   â”‚
â”‚    3) Sandbox isolation for Python       â”‚
â”‚    execution. (Impact: CRITICAL)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline  â”‚
â”‚    11): Ensure users understand 'Why'    â”‚
â”‚    the agent took an action.             â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX:     â”‚
â”‚    Make clear 'Why' the system did what  â”‚
â”‚    it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the      â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI:         â”‚
â”‚    Collapse reasoning traces behind      â”‚
â”‚    'View Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: â”‚
â”‚    For high-stakes reasoning, move       â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent      â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2)       â”‚
â”‚    Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore       â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3)          â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own  â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG        â”‚
â”‚    Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline. â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for  â”‚
â”‚    'Malicious Fragments' in fetched      â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM  â”‚
â”‚    verification (Small model scans       â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline â”‚
â”‚    01): Don't leave users guessing.      â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear    â”‚
â”‚    what the system can do. 2) UI:        â”‚
â”‚    Provide 'Capability Cards' or         â”‚
â”‚    proactive tool suggestions. 3)        â”‚
â”‚    Discovery: Show sample queries on     â”‚
â”‚    empty state. (Impact: MEDIUM)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven    â”‚
â”‚    Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex      â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven    â”‚
â”‚    agentic logic. This replaces rigid    â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic          â”‚
â”‚    state-based event loop that is more   â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: HIGH)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Recursive Self-Improvement            â”‚
â”‚    (Self-Reflexion Loops): Integrate     â”‚
â”‚    Recursive Self-Reflexion. Research    â”‚
â”‚    from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths    â”‚
â”‚    reduce hallucination by 40%. (Impact: â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SLM-on-the-Edge (Gemma 3 / Phi-4      â”‚
â”‚    Optimization): Offload deterministic  â”‚
â”‚    sub-tasks (JSON parsing, routing) to  â”‚
â”‚    Gemma 3-2b or Phi-4-mini on local     â”‚
â”‚    edge. Reasoning: Token cost for Feb   â”‚
â”‚    2026 frontier models makes SLM        â”‚
â”‚    offloading an 85% OpEx win. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop:       â”‚
â”‚    Detected a self-referencing agent     â”‚
â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚

â”‚    (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc      â”‚
â”‚    context passing. Adopting UCP         â”‚

â”‚    Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework  â”‚
â”‚    interoperability. (Impact: LOW)       â”‚

â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Payload Splitting (Context            â”‚
â”‚    Fragmentation): Monitor for Payload   â”‚
â”‚    Splitting attacks where malicious     â”‚
â”‚    fragments are combined over multiple  â”‚
â”‚    turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement       â”‚
â”‚    sliding window verification. 2) Use   â”‚
â”‚    'DARE Prompting' (Determine           â”‚
â”‚    Appropriate Response) to re-evaluate  â”‚
â”‚    intent at every turn. (Impact: HIGH)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agentic Observability (Golden         â”‚
â”‚    Signals): Monitor the Agentic         â”‚
â”‚    Trinity: 1) Reasoning Trace           â”‚
â”‚    (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to      â”‚
â”‚    First Token (TTFT). 3) Cost per       â”‚
â”‚    Intent. Microsoft Agent Kit           â”‚
â”‚    recommends 'Trace-based Debugging'    â”‚
â”‚    for multi-agent loops. (Impact:       â”‚

â”‚    consider pivoting to Gemma2 or        â”‚
â”‚    Llama3-70B on Vertex AI Prediction    â”‚
â”‚    endpoints. (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚

â”‚    Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear    â”‚
â”‚    what the system can do. 2) UI:        â”‚
â”‚    Provide 'Capability Cards' or         â”‚
â”‚    proactive tool suggestions. 3)        â”‚
â”‚    Discovery: Show sample queries on     â”‚
â”‚    empty state. (Impact: MEDIUM)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Strategic Conflict:                   â”‚
â”‚    Multi-Orchestrator Setup: Detected    â”‚
â”‚    both LangGraph and CrewAI. Using two  â”‚
â”‚    loop managers is a 'High-Entropy'     â”‚
â”‚    pattern that often leads to cyclic    â”‚
â”‚    state deadlocks. (Impact: HIGH)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Strategic Exit Plan (Cloud): Detected â”‚
â”‚    hardcoded cloud dependencies. For a   â”‚
â”‚    'Category Killer' grade, implement an â”‚
â”‚    abstraction layer that allows         â”‚
â”‚    switching to Gemma 2 on GKE. (Impact: â”‚
â”‚    INFO)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop:       â”‚
â”‚    Detected a self-referencing agent     â”‚
â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sub-Optimal Vector Networking (REST): â”‚
â”‚    Detected REST-based vector retrieval. â”‚
â”‚    High-concurrency agents should use    â”‚
â”‚    gRPC to reduce 'Cognitive Tax' by 40% â”‚
â”‚    and prevent tail-latency spikes.      â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk: Cloud   â”‚
â”‚    Run detected. MISSING                 â”‚
â”‚    startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+  â”‚
â”‚    cold starts. A slow TTR makes the     â”‚
â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on       â”‚
â”‚    Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sovereign Model Migration             â”‚
â”‚    Opportunity: Detected OpenAI          â”‚
â”‚    dependency. For maximum Data          â”‚
â”‚    Sovereignty and 40% TCO reduction,    â”‚
â”‚    consider pivoting to Gemma2 or        â”‚
â”‚    Llama3-70B on Vertex AI Prediction    â”‚
â”‚    endpoints. (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Vector Store Evolution (Chroma DB):   â”‚
â”‚    For enterprise scaling, evaluate: 1)  â”‚
â”‚    Google Cloud: Vertex AI Search for    â”‚
â”‚    handled grounding. 2) AWS: Amazon     â”‚
â”‚    Bedrock Knowledge Bases. 3) General:  â”‚
â”‚    BigQuery Vector Search for high-scale â”‚
â”‚    analytical joins. (Impact: HIGH)      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Model Resilience & Fallbacks:         â”‚
â”‚    Implement multi-provider fallback.    â”‚
â”‚    Options: 1) AWS: Apply Generative AI  â”‚
â”‚    Lens 'Model Fallback' patterns. 2)    â”‚
â”‚    Azure: Use API Management for         â”‚
â”‚    cross-region load balancing. 3)       â”‚
â”‚    LangGraph: Implement conditional      â”‚
â”‚    edges for a 'Retry with Larger Model' â”‚
â”‚    flow. (Impact: HIGH)                  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Enterprise Identity (Identity         â”‚
â”‚    Sprawl): Move beyond static keys.     â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) GCP: Workload Identity  â”‚
â”‚    Federation. 2) AWS: Private VPC       â”‚
â”‚    Endpoints + IAM Role-based access. 3) â”‚
â”‚    Azure: Managed Identities for all     â”‚
â”‚    tool interactions. (Impact: CRITICAL) â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Payload Splitting (Context            â”‚
â”‚    Fragmentation): Monitor for Payload   â”‚
â”‚    Splitting attacks where malicious     â”‚
â”‚    fragments are combined over multiple  â”‚
â”‚    turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement       â”‚
â”‚    sliding window verification. 2) Use   â”‚
â”‚    'DARE Prompting' (Determine           â”‚
â”‚    Appropriate Response) to re-evaluate  â”‚
â”‚    intent at every turn. (Impact: HIGH)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing Safety Classifiers:           â”‚
â”‚    Supplement prompt-based safety with   â”‚
â”‚    programmatic layers: 1) Input Level:  â”‚
â”‚    ShieldGemma or LLM Guard. 2) Output   â”‚
â”‚    Level: Sentiment Analysis and         â”‚
â”‚    Category Checks (GCP Natural Language â”‚
â”‚    API). 3) Persona: Tone of Voice       â”‚
â”‚    controllers. (Impact: HIGH)           â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Agentic Observability (Golden         â”‚
â”‚    Signals): Monitor the Agentic         â”‚
â”‚    Trinity: 1) Reasoning Trace           â”‚
â”‚    (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to      â”‚
â”‚    First Token (TTFT). 3) Cost per       â”‚
â”‚    Intent. Microsoft Agent Kit           â”‚
â”‚    recommends 'Trace-based Debugging'    â”‚
â”‚    for multi-agent loops. (Impact:       â”‚
â”‚    MEDIUM)                               â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP   â”‚
â”‚    LLM06): Audit tool permissions        â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive        â”‚
â”‚    Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM   â”‚
â”‚    for tool execution. 2)                â”‚
â”‚    Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for          â”‚
â”‚    destructive actions (Delete/Write).   â”‚
â”‚    3) Sandbox isolation for Python       â”‚
â”‚    execution. (Impact: CRITICAL)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline  â”‚
â”‚    11): Ensure users understand 'Why'    â”‚
â”‚    the agent took an action.             â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX:     â”‚
â”‚    Make clear 'Why' the system did what  â”‚
â”‚    it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the      â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI:         â”‚
â”‚    Collapse reasoning traces behind      â”‚
â”‚    'View Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: â”‚
â”‚    For high-stakes reasoning, move       â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent      â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2)       â”‚
â”‚    Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore       â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3)          â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own  â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG        â”‚
â”‚    Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline. â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for  â”‚
â”‚    'Malicious Fragments' in fetched      â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM  â”‚
â”‚    verification (Small model scans       â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline â”‚
â”‚    01): Don't leave users guessing.      â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear    â”‚
â”‚    what the system can do. 2) UI:        â”‚
â”‚    Provide 'Capability Cards' or         â”‚
â”‚    proactive tool suggestions. 3)        â”‚
â”‚    Discovery: Show sample queries on     â”‚
â”‚    empty state. (Impact: MEDIUM)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven    â”‚
â”‚    Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex      â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven    â”‚
â”‚    agentic logic. This replaces rigid    â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic          â”‚
â”‚    state-based event loop that is more   â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: HIGH)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Recursive Self-Improvement            â”‚
â”‚    (Self-Reflexion Loops): Integrate     â”‚
â”‚    Recursive Self-Reflexion. Research    â”‚
â”‚    from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths    â”‚
â”‚    reduce hallucination by 40%. (Impact: â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Incompatible Duo: langgraph + crewai: â”‚
â”‚    CrewAI and LangGraph both attempt to  â”‚
â”‚    manage the orchestration loop and     â”‚
â”‚    state, leading to cyclic-dependency   â”‚
â”‚    conflicts. (Impact: CRITICAL)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚

â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚

â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚

â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚

â”‚    static context (>5k chars) detected   â”‚
â”‚    in system instruction. This risks     â”‚
â”‚    'Lost in the Middle' hallucinations.  â”‚

â”‚    is returning raw HTML/UI strings      â”‚
â”‚    without A2UI surfaceId mapping. This  â”‚
â”‚    breaks the 'Push-based GenUI'         â”‚
â”‚    standard. (Impact: HIGH)              â”‚

â”‚    Run detected. MISSING                 â”‚

â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚

â”‚    (KV-Cache). Low-memory instances      â”‚
â”‚    degrade reasoning speed. Consider     â”‚
â”‚    memory-optimized nodes (>4GB).        â”‚

â”‚    state machines with persistence       â”‚
â”‚    (checkpoints). 2) CrewAI: Best for    â”‚

â”‚    collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer   â”‚
â”‚    'Workflows over Agents' for           â”‚

â”‚  â€¢ Adversarial Testing (Red Teaming):    â”‚
â”‚    Implement 5-layer Red Teaming: 1)     â”‚
â”‚    Quality (Customer queries). 2) Safety â”‚
â”‚    (Slurs/Profanity). 3) Sensitive       â”‚
â”‚    Topics (Politics/Legal). 4) Off-topic â”‚
â”‚    (Canned response check). 5) Language  â”‚
â”‚    (Non-supported language override).    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: HIGH)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Structured Output Enforcement:        â”‚
â”‚    Eliminate parsing failures. 1)        â”‚
â”‚    OpenAI: Use 'Structured Outputs' for  â”‚
â”‚    guaranteed schema. 2) GCP:            â”‚
â”‚    Application Mimetype                  â”‚
â”‚    (application/json) enforcement. 3)    â”‚
â”‚    LangGraph: Pydantic-based state       â”‚
â”‚    validation. (Impact: MEDIUM)          â”‚

â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM  â”‚
â”‚    verification (Small model scans       â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Recursive Self-Improvement            â”‚
â”‚    (Self-Reflexion Loops): Integrate     â”‚
â”‚    Recursive Self-Reflexion. Research    â”‚
â”‚    from ArXiv (cs.AI) proves that agents â”‚
â”‚    auditing their own reasoning paths    â”‚
â”‚    reduce hallucination by 40%. (Impact: â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Architectural Prompt Bloat: Massive   â”‚
â”‚    static context (>5k chars) detected   â”‚
â”‚    in system instruction. This risks     â”‚
â”‚    'Lost in the Middle' hallucinations.  â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop:       â”‚
â”‚    Detected a self-referencing agent     â”‚
â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Structured Output Enforcement:        â”‚
â”‚    Eliminate parsing failures. 1)        â”‚
â”‚    OpenAI: Use 'Structured Outputs' for  â”‚
â”‚    guaranteed schema. 2) GCP:            â”‚
â”‚    Application Mimetype                  â”‚
â”‚    (application/json) enforcement. 3)    â”‚
â”‚    LangGraph: Pydantic-based state       â”‚
â”‚    validation. (Impact: MEDIUM)          â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline  â”‚
â”‚    11): Ensure users understand 'Why'    â”‚
â”‚    the agent took an action.             â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX:     â”‚
â”‚    Make clear 'Why' the system did what  â”‚
â”‚    it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the      â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI:         â”‚
â”‚    Collapse reasoning traces behind      â”‚
â”‚    'View Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: â”‚
â”‚    For high-stakes reasoning, move       â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent      â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2)       â”‚
â”‚    Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore       â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3)          â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own  â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG        â”‚
â”‚    Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline. â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for  â”‚
â”‚    'Malicious Fragments' in fetched      â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM  â”‚
â”‚    verification (Small model scans       â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven    â”‚
â”‚    Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex      â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven    â”‚
â”‚    agentic logic. This replaces rigid    â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic          â”‚
â”‚    state-based event loop that is more   â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: HIGH)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop:       â”‚
â”‚    Detected a self-referencing agent     â”‚
â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake         â”‚
â”‚    (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc      â”‚
â”‚    context passing. Adopting UCP         â”‚
â”‚    (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent     â”‚
â”‚    Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework  â”‚
â”‚    interoperability. (Impact: LOW)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk: Cloud   â”‚
â”‚    Run detected. MISSING                 â”‚
â”‚    startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+  â”‚
â”‚    cold starts. A slow TTR makes the     â”‚
â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on       â”‚
â”‚    Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Short-Term Memory (STM) at Risk:      â”‚
â”‚    Agent is storing session state in     â”‚
â”‚    local pod memory (dictionaries). A    â”‚
â”‚    GKE restart or Cloud Run scale-down   â”‚
â”‚    wipes the agent's brain. (Impact:     â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Payload Splitting (Context            â”‚
â”‚    Fragmentation): Monitor for Payload   â”‚
â”‚    Splitting attacks where malicious     â”‚
â”‚    fragments are combined over multiple  â”‚
â”‚    turns. Mitigation: 1) Implement       â”‚
â”‚    sliding window verification. 2) Use   â”‚
â”‚    'DARE Prompting' (Determine           â”‚
â”‚    Appropriate Response) to re-evaluate  â”‚
â”‚    intent at every turn. (Impact: HIGH)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing Safety Classifiers:           â”‚
â”‚    Supplement prompt-based safety with   â”‚
â”‚    programmatic layers: 1) Input Level:  â”‚
â”‚    ShieldGemma or LLM Guard. 2) Output   â”‚
â”‚    Level: Sentiment Analysis and         â”‚
â”‚    Category Checks (GCP Natural Language â”‚
â”‚    API). 3) Persona: Tone of Voice       â”‚
â”‚    controllers. (Impact: HIGH)           â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG        â”‚
â”‚    Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline. â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for  â”‚
â”‚    'Malicious Fragments' in fetched      â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM  â”‚
â”‚    verification (Small model scans       â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline â”‚
â”‚    01): Don't leave users guessing.      â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear    â”‚
â”‚    what the system can do. 2) UI:        â”‚
â”‚    Provide 'Capability Cards' or         â”‚
â”‚    proactive tool suggestions. 3)        â”‚
â”‚    Discovery: Show sample queries on     â”‚
â”‚    empty state. (Impact: MEDIUM)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven    â”‚

â”‚    agentic logic. This replaces rigid    â”‚

â”‚    state machines with persistence       â”‚
â”‚    (checkpoints). 2) CrewAI: Best for    â”‚
â”‚    role-based hierarchical               â”‚
â”‚    collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer   â”‚
â”‚    'Workflows over Agents' for           â”‚
â”‚    high-predictability tasks.            â”‚

â”‚    workloads are Memory-Bound            â”‚
â”‚    (KV-Cache). Low-memory instances      â”‚
â”‚    degrade reasoning speed. Consider     â”‚
â”‚    memory-optimized nodes (>4GB).        â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: LOW)                         â”‚

â”‚    endpoints. (Impact: HIGH)             â”‚

â”‚    Lens 'Model Fallback' patterns. 2)    â”‚
â”‚    Azure: Use API Management for         â”‚
â”‚    cross-region load balancing. 3)       â”‚

â”‚    First Token (TTFT). 3) Cost per       â”‚
â”‚    Intent. Microsoft Agent Kit           â”‚
â”‚    recommends 'Trace-based Debugging'    â”‚
â”‚    for multi-agent loops. (Impact:       â”‚
â”‚    MEDIUM)                               â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP   â”‚
â”‚    LLM06): Audit tool permissions        â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive        â”‚
â”‚    Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM   â”‚
â”‚    for tool execution. 2)                â”‚
â”‚    Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for          â”‚
â”‚    destructive actions (Delete/Write).   â”‚
â”‚    3) Sandbox isolation for Python       â”‚
â”‚    execution. (Impact: CRITICAL)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline  â”‚
â”‚    11): Ensure users understand 'Why'    â”‚
â”‚    the agent took an action.             â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX:     â”‚
â”‚    Make clear 'Why' the system did what  â”‚
â”‚    it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the      â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI:         â”‚
â”‚    Collapse reasoning traces behind      â”‚
â”‚    'View Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: â”‚
â”‚    For high-stakes reasoning, move       â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent      â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2)       â”‚
â”‚    Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore       â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3)          â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own  â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Mental Model Discovery (HAX Guideline â”‚
â”‚    01): Don't leave users guessing.      â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) HAX: Make clear    â”‚
â”‚    what the system can do. 2) UI:        â”‚
â”‚    Provide 'Capability Cards' or         â”‚
â”‚    proactive tool suggestions. 3)        â”‚
â”‚    Discovery: Show sample queries on     â”‚
â”‚    empty state. (Impact: MEDIUM)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ LlamaIndex Workflows (Event-Driven    â”‚
â”‚    Reasoning): Adopt the LlamaIndex      â”‚
â”‚    Workflow (v0.14+) for event-driven    â”‚
â”‚    agentic logic. This replaces rigid    â”‚
â”‚    linear chains with a dynamic          â”‚
â”‚    state-based event loop that is more   â”‚
â”‚    resilient to complex user intents.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: HIGH)                        â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake         â”‚
â”‚    (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc      â”‚
â”‚    context passing. Adopting UCP         â”‚
â”‚    (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent     â”‚
â”‚    Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework  â”‚
â”‚    interoperability. (Impact: LOW)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Time-to-Reasoning (TTR) Risk: Cloud   â”‚
â”‚    Run detected. MISSING                 â”‚
â”‚    startup_cpu_boost. High risk of 10s+  â”‚
â”‚    cold starts. A slow TTR makes the     â”‚
â”‚    agent's first response 'Dead on       â”‚
â”‚    Arrival' for users. (Impact: HIGH)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sub-Optimal Resource Profile: LLM     â”‚
â”‚    workloads are Memory-Bound            â”‚
â”‚    (KV-Cache). Low-memory instances      â”‚
â”‚    degrade reasoning speed. Consider     â”‚
â”‚    memory-optimized nodes (>4GB).        â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: LOW)                         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Explainable Reasoning (HAX Guideline  â”‚
â”‚    11): Ensure users understand 'Why'    â”‚
â”‚    the agent took an action.             â”‚
â”‚    Implementation: 1) Microsoft HAX:     â”‚
â”‚    Make clear 'Why' the system did what  â”‚
â”‚    it did. 2) Google PAIR: Show the      â”‚
â”‚    source for RAG claims. 3) UI:         â”‚
â”‚    Collapse reasoning traces behind      â”‚
â”‚    'View Steps' toggles. (Impact: HIGH)  â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG        â”‚
â”‚    Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline. â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for  â”‚
â”‚    'Malicious Fragments' in fetched      â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM  â”‚
â”‚    verification (Small model scans       â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ SOC2 Control Gap: Missing Transit     â”‚
â”‚    Logging: Structural logging           â”‚
â”‚    (logger.info/error) not detected.     â”‚
â”‚    SOC2 CC6.1 requires audit trails for  â”‚
â”‚    all system access. (Impact: HIGH)     â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop:       â”‚
â”‚    Detected a self-referencing agent     â”‚
â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake         â”‚
â”‚    (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc      â”‚
â”‚    context passing. Adopting UCP         â”‚
â”‚    (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent     â”‚
â”‚    Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework  â”‚
â”‚    interoperability. (Impact: LOW)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Structured Output Enforcement:        â”‚
â”‚    Eliminate parsing failures. 1)        â”‚
â”‚    OpenAI: Use 'Structured Outputs' for  â”‚
â”‚    guaranteed schema. 2) GCP:            â”‚
â”‚    Application Mimetype                  â”‚
â”‚    (application/json) enforcement. 3)    â”‚
â”‚    LangGraph: Pydantic-based state       â”‚
â”‚    validation. (Impact: MEDIUM)          â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Excessive Agency & Privilege (OWASP   â”‚
â”‚    LLM06): Audit tool permissions        â”‚
â”‚    against MITRE ATLAS 'Excessive        â”‚
â”‚    Agency'. Implement: 1) Granular IAM   â”‚
â”‚    for tool execution. 2)                â”‚
â”‚    Human-In-The-Loop (HITL) for          â”‚
â”‚    destructive actions (Delete/Write).   â”‚
â”‚    3) Sandbox isolation for Python       â”‚
â”‚    execution. (Impact: CRITICAL)         â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) & Consensus: â”‚
â”‚    For high-stakes reasoning, move       â”‚
â”‚    beyond single-shot ReAct. Implement:  â”‚
â”‚    1) Multi-Agent Debate: One agent      â”‚
â”‚    proposes, another critiques. 2)       â”‚
â”‚    Tree-of-Thoughts (ToT): Explore       â”‚
â”‚    multiple reasoning paths. 3)          â”‚
â”‚    Self-Reflexion: Agent audits its own  â”‚
â”‚    output before transmission. (Impact:  â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Indirect Prompt Injection (RAG        â”‚
â”‚    Hardening): Protect the RAG pipeline. â”‚
â”‚    Implement: 1) Input Sanitization for  â”‚
â”‚    'Malicious Fragments' in fetched      â”‚
â”‚    docs. 2) 'Strict Context' prompts     â”‚
â”‚    that forbid following instructions    â”‚
â”‚    found in retrieved data. 3) Dual LLM  â”‚
â”‚    verification (Small model scans       â”‚
â”‚    retrieval context before the Large    â”‚
â”‚    model sees it). (Impact: CRITICAL)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sequential Bottleneck Detected:       â”‚
â”‚    Multiple sequential 'await' calls     â”‚
â”‚    identified. This increases total      â”‚
â”‚    latency linearly. (Impact: MEDIUM)    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sequential Data Fetching Bottleneck:  â”‚
â”‚    Function 'execute_tool' has 4         â”‚
â”‚    sequential await calls. This          â”‚
â”‚    increases latency linearly            â”‚
â”‚    (T1+T2+T3). (Impact: MEDIUM)          â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ HIPAA Risk: Potential Unencrypted     â”‚
â”‚    ePHI: Database interaction detected   â”‚
â”‚    without explicit encryption or secret â”‚
â”‚    management headers. (Impact:          â”‚
â”‚    CRITICAL)                             â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Potential Recursive Agent Loop:       â”‚
â”‚    Detected a self-referencing agent     â”‚
â”‚    call pattern. Risk of infinite        â”‚
â”‚    reasoning loops and runaway costs.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: CRITICAL)                    â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Proprietary Context Handshake         â”‚
â”‚    (Non-AP2): Agent is using ad-hoc      â”‚
â”‚    context passing. Adopting UCP         â”‚
â”‚    (Universal Context) or AP2 (Agent     â”‚
â”‚    Protocol v2) ensures cross-framework  â”‚
â”‚    interoperability. (Impact: LOW)       â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Sub-Optimal Vector Networking (REST): â”‚
â”‚    Detected REST-based vector retrieval. â”‚
â”‚    High-concurrency agents should use    â”‚
â”‚    gRPC to reduce 'Cognitive Tax' by 40% â”‚
â”‚    and prevent tail-latency spikes.      â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Short-Term Memory (STM) at Risk:      â”‚
â”‚    Agent is storing session state in     â”‚
â”‚    local pod memory (dictionaries). A    â”‚
â”‚    GKE restart or Cloud Run scale-down   â”‚
â”‚    wipes the agent's brain. (Impact:     â”‚
â”‚    HIGH)                                 â”‚
â”‚  â€¢ Missing 5th Golden Signal             â”‚
â”‚    (TTFT/Tracing): Structural tracing    â”‚
â”‚    instrumentation (OTEL/Cloud Trace)    â”‚
â”‚    not detected. TTFT is the primary     â”‚
â”‚    metric for perceived intelligence.    â”‚
â”‚    (Impact: MEDIUM)                      â”‚

â”‚  â€¢ Orchestration Pattern Selection: When â”‚
â”‚    evaluating orchestration, consider:   â”‚
â”‚    1) LangGraph: Use for complex cyclic  â”‚
â”‚    state machines with persistence       â”‚
â”‚    (checkpoints). 2) CrewAI: Best for    â”‚
â”‚    role-based hierarchical               â”‚
â”‚    collaboration. 3) Anthropic: Prefer   â”‚
â”‚    'Workflows over Agents' for           â”‚
â”‚    high-predictability tasks.            â”‚
â”‚                                          â”‚

â”‚ Self-Reflexion to reduce hallucination   â”‚
â”‚ by 40%. (Source: ArXiv Intelligence Sync â”‚
â”‚ (Feb 2026)) (Impact: MEDIUM)             â”‚

â”‚  â€¢ Missing Safety Classifiers:           â”‚
â”‚    Supplement prompt-based safety with   â”‚
â”‚    programmatic layers: 1) Input Level:  â”‚
â”‚    ShieldGemma or LLM Guard. 2) Output   â”‚
â”‚    Level: Sentiment Analysis and         â”‚
â”‚    Category Checks (GCP Natural Language â”‚
â”‚    API). 3) Persona: Tone of Voice       â”‚
â”‚    controllers. (Impact: HIGH)           â”‚

â”‚    (LangSmith/AgentOps). 2) Time to      â”‚

â”‚    reduce hallucination by 40%. (Impact: â”‚
